results.description:
Hi,

For everyone who has their full legal name in their RSVP or on their profile, you can enter through building security from 5:45-6pm and just come up to the 8th floor reception area.  Otherwise we will be ferrying people from the lobby to the 8th floor from 6-6:40.  If you arrive later than 6:40 please text me directly @[masked] and we'll send someone down.

Schedule:

5:45-6:45 - Networking (we will have beer/snacks)

6:45-8 - Speakers w/ 5 minute breaks in between and raffle

8-8:30 - Networking

==

We're excited to have our next meetup @ Flatiron Health


As organizations adopt Amazon Web Services, developers and security teams can find themselves working at odds. Developers want to move fast, using Agile methodologies and DevOps to push frequent updates and code changes. Security teams want thorough procedures and security processes for compliance. The solution? DevSecOps—a set of practices designed to integrate security services and best practices into continuous integration systems. Learn why DevSecOps is important, and how enterprises are leveraging it to meet and maximize their security in the cloud.


Presentations:

* Michael Capicotto, AWS Solutions Architect, who runs the AWS DevSecOps boot camp at re:Invent, will present "Best DevSecOps Practices with AWS"


* Ryan Holland, Cloud Platform Solution Director at Alert Logic, will present "Securing Healthcare Data on AWS for HIPAA Compliance” 


* Dominic Tancredi, CEO of <a>www.domandtom.com,</a> will present "HIPAA App Development"

Looking forward to seeing you all there!  

*Alert Logic will be giving away an Amazon Echo at the meetup!
results.how_to_find_us: Large entrance on 5th ave just north of 23rd
results.name: May Meetup

results.description:
Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.
results.name: FREE West African Dance Class!!

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience!  It will also be full of great music from the 80's! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event.

-80's Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect: 60-100 people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come? To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

results.description:
Getting Into NYC Kindergarten can be a 2 year long process, and parents can't have true school choice until they know all their choices - and the secrets to getting them. This 90 minute workshop will cover: * Public School/General Ed (zoned and unzoned) * Public School Gifted & Talented (District & Citywide) * Public School Dual Language * Public School Magnet Programs * Charter Schools * Hunter College Elementary School * Private Schools (Independent and Religious) * Test Prep (Hunter, G&T & private school) * Insider Application Tips * Working the Waitlist * Application Timeline 

Details: 

*25 slots 

*Cost: Free

*To reserve your spot, RSVP at the class page below

http://www.nory.co/class/alina4/
results.name: (Free Workshop) Everything You Need to Know About Getting Into NYC Kindergarten

results.description:
iMakr will be offering free 3D printing training at the iMakr Store in New York.

This training is best suited for people who are looking at purchasing a 3D printer, or are just interested in the technology, and want to learn more about the machines and software.

The iMakr Store is located at 152 Allen Street, Lower East Side.

The following points will be covered during the training session:

• Intro to 3D Printing - What to look for in a Printer?

• Intro to the printer - Cubicon Single

• Intro to the Software (slicer)

• Ongoing maintenance

• Common troubles

• Workflow, tips and tricks

If you have any question, please email us at [masked]

We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: How to 3D print with HyVision Cubicon

results.description:
The Old Stone House will host our group on the first Wednesday of each month in 2016. Come slow jam with us!

For more information about how our sessions work, please check out the Intro Page. For information about the tunes we're playing these days, check out the Tune List. I will be posting what we play each night and there will be lots of repeats so we gain familiarity.  

Donations:  We're asking that folks donate $5-10 at each session, if you are able.  We'll be putting out a donation jar and this money will pay our fantastic jam leader (who will play the songs completely, loudly and in-tune for all to follow) and provide a donation to the Old Stone House for providing us with such a beautiful space to play in.


You may bring food and drink into the space, just be sure to clean up after yourself.  We should leave the place as we found it.

See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Door will be open, we'll be in the Great Hall, and it's okay to come and go when you need to

results.description:
Knotel is excited to host this series of events celebrating and highlighting women’s achievements in industries both focused on and overlapping with technology. We are kicking-off the first of many events with the topic: How Women in Tech Are Making Fashion Smart. 

Two women who have a lot to say on this topic are Sophie Kahn and Bouchra Ezzahraoui, founders of AUrate. AUrate is the startup giving the jewelry industry a much needed makeover. By using a direct-to-consumer business model, where the jewelry travels from the production studio to your door, AUrate’s online scructure is not only the smarter way to buy high quality gold jewelry, but also the most charitable. For each piece of jewelry purchased, AUrate donates a book to an underprivileged child. Join us as these two brilliant business-women and founders talk us through what passions and pushes drive their business and what it means to them to be representing women in the tech scene.

Admission for this event is $5 | Covers refreshments and snacks Please RSVP on Eventbrite: http://tinyurl.com/z3g3ptv
results.name: How Women in Tech are Making Fashion Smart

results.description:
AI: Minimax Theorem


When you hear the words 'artificial intelligence' talking robots may come to mind. But this month let's get real with it and look at the theoretical concepts behind AI.

Join us for cocktails in downtown Brooklyn as App Partner developers Mike Lepore and Joe Levin discuss decision theory for minimizing the possible loss for a worst case (maximum loss) scenario.
results.name: May Lecture: AI Minimax Theorem

results.description:
Sticking to the NYEW objective of greater gender diversity, we have an amazing speaker this week, see below for details.

RSVP is required.  Due to building security, no walk-ins will be allowed.


Meeting Format:

6:00pm - Doors open.  Pizza and beer served.  


6:30pm - Meeting kicks off with welcoming remarks, followed by featured presentation by Marisol Rodriguez on the topic below

7:00pm - NYEW updates, idea storm, and sector-lead group breakout sessions until 7:45pm.

"EVERY SECOND OF SAVED POWER COUNTS"

How the sharing economy can change the energy sector and impact sustainable development.

Marisol Rodriguez is a Design Consultant with over ten years of experience in product development and sustainability. She built her career in design research and innovation, working for brands such as Nike, Colgate, Energizer, World Resources Institute and Unicef. Most recently collaborating with social enterprises and academia to refine, monitor and evaluate consumer and digital products for communities in sub-saharan africa and Latin America.

She is Founder of SHAREnergy.world, a clean-tech initiative that engages buildings, stores and homeowners to reduce energy consumption in NYC.  Energy savings achieved through awareness campaigns are used to finance solar products for communities living off-grid in developing countries. She received her M.S. in Sustainability Management from Columbia University, a B.A. in 

Industrial Design from Universidad de Los Andes, and completed an Energy Risk fellowship at the University of Geneva. 

Mrs. Rodriguez remains active within the energy community through outreach and public speaking engagements. She has participated as a panelist for CUNY’s  “Sustainable Energy and Design Conference”, showcased research at The Earth Institute on 

"Designing Financial Models for Energy equality in Nepal & Colombia”, and is an active volunteer at the Cooper-Hewitt Museum mentoring teenage girls to engage in STEM, design and sustainability careers.
results.name: NYEW 2016 May Steering Committee Meetup

Why should I come? To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

We usually have many more people who attend than who RSVP. We try to adjust the numbers on the Meetup to reflect that, but we err on the side of lowballing. As of Nov. 2015 we are averaging out around 25 people throughout the night though for special events we've had up to 80.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]

results.description:
Only $110 for the entire 8 week semester! Please email or message el centro to confirm we are still accepting students before coming to this class.


The Level 2 Spanish class is for students who already have the ability to form and understand simple sentences. Students will expand their vocabulary in Spanish and learn to use past tenses. The use of the present tense will also continue and students will also be introduced to the combination of tenses.  Students will participate in discussions, songs and games and will improve their reading and writing skills at a basic level, but with more understanding on the formation of sentences and phrases. The lessons will focus on the use of the Spanish language for common situations such as ordering in restaurants, planning a trip, visits to the doctor and employment.

La clase de Nivel 2 de español es para estudiantes que ya tienen la capacidad de formar y entender oraciones sencillas en español. Los estudiantes ampliarán su vocabulario y aprenderán a usar los tiempos en el pasado.  El uso del presente tambien continuará y los alumnos también serán introducidos a la combinación de los tiempos verbales.  Los estudiantes participarán en conversaciones, canciones y juegos y mejorarán sus habilidades en la lectura y la escritura en español a un nivel basico, pero con mas entendimiento sobre la formación de oraciones y frases.  Las lecciones se concentrarán en el uso del idioma con la práctica de situaciones comunes como ordenar en restaurantes, la planificación de un viaje, visitas al medico y el empleo.
results.name: Spanish 2 - Conversational Spanish

results.description:
This week's lab is a part of the city-wide Creative Tech Week. Join us for our usual hardware hacking and creative coding, plus a performance from two of our regular members, Gordey and Anirudh.

Here's what they have to say about what they are doing:


"Join us for a different kind of "jam session" featuring spoken word poet, Anirudh "Eka", and animator, Gordey Cherney. The performance will be featuring a live animation tool built by Gordey in OF that lets him animate instantly as Anirudh performs a piece about endless war. Afterwards, we hope to get suggestion on improving the piece and more broadly discuss how the ancient tradition of oral poetry can reinvent itself in the modern age. 

See more of Anirudh's work at toomanynames.com and Gordey's at gordich.com. Check out a similar performance Gordey did with a dancer here.

-------------------------------

HARDWARE HACK LAB

WHAT WE DO


Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING 

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.
results.name: Hardware Hack Lab // Creative Tech Week

RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future.

Please note that meetup events are strictly for members. No +1s are allowed as spots are assigned in advance. First time members must confirm in writing that they will attend. Individuals that are no shows are immediately banned from the group. Thanks.

Microsoft Azure is seeing strong growth in the public cloud market along with exciting plans for an on-premise Azure Stack offering later this year. Pivotal is proud to host Gil Isaacs and Stuart Charlton to discuss Pivotal Cloud Foundry on Microsoft Azure and Microsoft’s work in the Cloud Foundry community. Gil is a Microsoft Developer Evangelist and a specialist in Architecting Microsoft Azure Solutions. Stuart is an Advisory Platform Architect working closely with Pivotal’s customers across North America.


Gil will be talking to us about Microsoft’s work with Cloud Foundry and the open source community. Microsoft has contributed the BOSH Cloud Provider Interface (CPI) for CF on Azure. Gil will also discuss the efforts in bringing Azure services into the Cloud Foundry marketplace.


Stuart will demo and talk about the Azure Marketplace offering of Pivotal Cloud Foundry, a quick and easy way to get PCF and common marketplace services up and running on Azure with just a few clicks.

Agenda :

6:30 - 7 pm - Food and Networking

7.00 - 8:30 pm - Event

8:30 - 9 pm - Closing Remarks and Networking

HOW TO STUDY FOR JAVA 9 CERTIFCATION AND SAVE MONEY ON THE ORACLE EXAMS

Who: Jeanne Boyarsky - coAuthor Amazon Best-Seller "Oracle Java 8 Study Guide"


REGISTER-> https://goo.gl/hZohLJ    <--------------------------
Do not register on meetup.com

TO UN-REGISTER: visit eventbrite.com, go to Tickets, find the mtg, click on "Cancel"


HOW TO STUDY FOR JAVA 9 CERTIFICATION
======================================
Java 9 is coming soon! You want to be formally certified as a Java developer who fully understands the new features in the language and how to use them effectively. Oracle offers a steeply discounted rate on certification exams like the OCA and OCP if you take them during the beta period. The catch is there aren’t study guides available and you often don’t have enough time to study. In this session, attendees will learn how to approach studying for a certification exam without a study guide. In this session, we will use some of the planned Java 9 features as examples to develop this technique. We have very limited seating for this workgroup, so please only register if you really are attending. Thank you to West Monroe Partners for hosting, wifi, munchies and refreshments!

results.description:
Free science lecture with a cash bar.
It is a fun educational happy hour. 

Doors open at 6:30 pm. Lecture starts at 7:00 pm.
Q and A around 7:40 pm. Event ends around 8 pm 

Location: Cullman Hall of the Universe - Enter on 77th Street, museum staff will direct you to Cullman Hall

I will be in the front (3rd row) on the right side. Come over and say “Hi”. Come early to get a seat. 

SciCafe - Just Can’t Get Enough: Addiction & the Brain

Only a small percentage of people who try an illicit drug will go on to develop addiction. What makes one more vulnerable to addiction than another? Theories abound, from troubled childhoods to work stress to genetics. Psychiatrist Edmund Griffin explains how epidemiology, cocaine-addicted rats, and molecular neuroscience all help to shed light on one society’s most troubling questions: Why is it that some people just can’t get enough?

A landmark paper that describes a biological mechanism for the the "Gateway Hypothesis" that chronic exposure to drugs like nicotine, alcohol, or marijuana can increase vulnerability to an illicit drug like cocaine.

A Molecular Basis for Nicotine as a Gateway Drug

Review paper on the role of nicotine as a gateway drug.
Molecular Mechanism for a Gateway Drug: Epigenetic Changes Initiated by Nicotine Prime Gene Expression by Cocaine

A recent lecture (Dr. Griffin), at the NYU McSilver Institute for Poverty Policy and Research: How new insights from translational neuroscience inform clinical and social interventions in mental health.

About the Speaker
Edmund Griffin
Edmund Griffin is an Assistant Professor of Clinical Psychiatry in the Division of Neurobiology, Brain and Behavior in the Department of Psychiatry Columbia University. His research focuses on how environmental exposures alter the brain and increase vulnerability to compulsive drug use.

http://www.amnh.org/learn-teach/adults/scicafe/just-can-t-get-enough-addiction-the-brain?utm_source=wordfly&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=160426-pp-adults-scicafe-idday&utm_content=version_A&sourceNumber=1799
results.name: SciCafe - Just Can’t Get Enough: Addiction & the Brain

results.description:
Dear Dharma Drink Friends,

Intrigued by the culture, arts, history, and sacred traditions of Himalayan Asia?

Tashi Chodron, the organizer of Rubin Museum of Art's Himalayan Heritage meetup group has invited us to join them as she explores topics of interest through discussions, gallery tours, films, and meetings with guest speakers. The group is open to all.

---

Nepali women’s social justice group Adhikaar, together with writers, Meera Nair and Muna Gurung at Kundiman will present “A Letter Home,” a dynamic evening of spoken word and storytelling from ten Nepali and Tibetan women. They will present autobiographical letters written in response to Nepal’s 2015 earthquake that creatively express their experiences as women, immigrants, domestic workers, daughters, mothers, and more. This communal presentation of art is designed not only to record Asian American history but also generate a dialogue to spark change.

----


To help the museum expenses, the Rubin Museum will charge a nominal fee of $15. For more details see below.

Tickets may be purchased day of program at the Admissions desk or contact[masked] x344 to purchase ticket or visit RubinMuseum.org/adulteducation. Space is limited.

results.description:
Whatever area of science that you are engaged with - professionally or otherwise - smart communication skills are essential to getting out the good word! Personally I'm interested in learning impactful communication skills to speak more effectively about environmental sustainability.

Let's meet at 6:30 for a cup of tea in the Rubin cafe/bar, before the talk starts at 7. Cost for the talk is $40, or $36 for members.
These events sell out quickly!!
Purchase tickets here: http://rubinmuseum.org/events/event/anderson-brown-05-04-2016
. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
In this conversation, Chris Anderson, TED curator and master of the short talk, and storyteller and social researcher Brené Brown, share tips on how to communicate impactful ideas.

This conversation marks the publication of Chris Anderson’s TED TALKS: The Official TED Guide to Public Speaking in which he shares insights from such favorites as Sir Ken Robinson, Amy Cuddy, Bill Gates, Elizabeth Gilbert, Salman Khan, Dan Gilbert, Mary Roach, Matt Ridley, and dozens more—everything from how to craft your talk’s content to how you can be most effective on stage.

About the Speakers

Chris Anderson spent much of his early life in Pakistan, India and Afghanistan. Trained as a journalist after graduating from Oxford University with a degree in philosophy, Anderson launched more than one hundred successful magazines and websites before turning his attention to TED, which he and his nonprofit organization acquired in 2001. His TED mantra—“ideas worth spreading”—continues to blossom on an international scale.

Dr. Brené Brown is a research professor at the University of Houston Graduate College of Social Work. She has spent the past thirteen years studying vulnerability, courage, worthiness, and shame. Brown is the author of three #1 New York Times bestsellers: Rising Strong, Daring Greatly and The Gifts of Imperfection.

She is also the Founder and CEO of The Daring Way and COURAGEworks – an online learning community that offers eCourses, workshops, and interviews for individuals and organizations ready for braver living, loving, and leading. Dr. Brown’s 2010 TEDx Houston talk, ‘The Power of Vulnerability’, is one of the top five most viewed TED talks in the world, with over 25 million viewers.
results.name: Social Science @ The Rubin: The Secret to a Great Ted Talk, with Brene Brown

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

Recently, ransomware or the encryption virus has become a major threat to computer systems. The systems suffering these attacks become either locked up or their data files become inaccessible due to encryption by the attackers. The attackers then request a ransom in exchange for being able to unlock the systems or retrieve the files.

Please join us for a lecture, “Ransomware Virus Discussion” by Howard Edelman, of Edelman Business Systems, Garden City, NY.

The meeting will be held at a new location, LIU-Post Campus, Lorber Hall, <a>720 Northern Boulevard, Brookville, NY 11548</a>.

Attention Professional Engineers:  An application for .2 CEU credits (equivalent to 2 PDHs) has been applied for and approved. There will be no charge for these credits.

HOW TO STUDY FOR JAVA 9 CERTIFICATION
======================================
Java 9 is coming soon!  You want to be formally certified as a Java developer who fully understands the new features in the language and how to use them effectively.  Oracle offers a steeply discounted rate on certification exams like the OCA and OCP if you take them during the beta period. In this session, attendees will learn how to approach studying for a certification exam without a study guide. Welcome to TEAM Referral Network, where we are passionate about networking and connecting you with the right professionals to grow your business. TEAM Referral Network includes weekly meetings with your chapter, training programs, business development, and most importantly, quality business relationships.

HOW IT WORKS:

Membership is exclusive. Only one business for each category is allowed to join a TEAM Referral chapter. Weekly meetings give TEAM members the opportunity to market their business and get to know their fellow professionals and the business they represent. 

Members work together for a common goal: to increase their sales income and bottom line. 

WHY IT WORKS:

Everyone appreciates referrals! When people are looking for a product or service, a personal referral beats the Yellow Pages every time. Your business gains the competitive edge when a TEAM member refers someone to you and speaks well of your integrity, quality products and excellent service. If you do the same for your fellow TEAM members, everybody WINS!

There is so much more to TEAM Referral Network that happens outside of our chapter meetings. Members are encouraged to meet one-on-one with other members to get to know each other on a deeper level. The entire TEAM Referral Network has access to all members with the exclusive TEAM-sponsored member’s website. These “mini” websites give added value to your brand’s online presence and search engine rankings (SEO), as well as make it even easier for prospects to find your company online. TEAM Referral Network also provides regular business development trainings. TEAM Referral Network helps you exponentially expand your sphere of influence and grow your business referrals.

results.description:
Welcome to the food sharing economy. From dining platforms that let you eat in locals' homes while traveling to food delivery services that leverage home-cooks, startups are pioneering unique peer-to-peer technologies that aim to upend traditional dining. But the economics are tough. Kitchensurfing and Kitchit both shifted away from peer-to-peer models, and Dinner Lab and Kitchensurfing recently closed shop. 


Come hear how a few innovative startups are tackling the food sharing economy and network with the community at our May Food+Tech Meetup. Presenters will do a deep dive into their business models, challenges and lessons learned.

We'll have sustainable fish sausages from Prawn Shop, bowls from INDAY Matcha from MetaMatcha, coffee from Bottlista, beer and more snacks. 

SCHEDULE:

6:30 - 7:15: Networking + Snacks

7:15 - 8:45: Presentations + Q&A

8:45 - 9:30: More Networking

CONFIRMED PRESENTERS:

Nick Devane, Co-founder of Homemade - A suite of software tools that empower cooks to build a brand. Our toolset works across iOS, mobile web, and SMS to help cooks start selling and marketing food they produce at home.


Manal Kahi, Co-founder and CEO of Eat Offbeat - Eat Offbeat delivers authentic ethnic meals that are conceived, prepared and delivered by refugees in NYC. The platform introduces New Yorkers to new and off-the-beaten-path cuisines all the while creating job opportunities for talented home-cooks who are eager to share their culture through food. 

Noah Karesh, Co-Founder and CEO of Feastly - A global peer to peer marketplace empowering any chef to showcase and host pop-ups, supper clubs, home dinners, and other food experiences. Through the marketplace eaters can easily find and attend these unique meals.

Bill Bodell, Founder of FarmShare - FarmShare is a community-supported agriculture platform for the 21st century. CSA is a business model that has existed for decades, in which community members pay up front to fund a farm's startup costs in exchange for weekly deliveries of fresh food. Initially the goal was to encourage greater community participation in local food economies, but lately it has become essentially a convenient marketing strategy. FarmShare aims to reboot this model, by allowing members to earn digital 'shares' by contributing their time, labor, resources and funds to the local agricultural community, which they can then redeem for fresh, delicious food from a network of local farmers and food entrepreneurs.
results.name: The Business of Peer-to-Peer Food

A long long time ago, in a galaxy far far away, QueensJS hosted their 22nd meetup on Wednesday, May 4th, at their usual haunt, Raven’s Head Pub in Astoria on 38th & Broadway, just around the corner from the Steinway MR stop and 7 short streets over from the Broadway NQ stop.


Your Jedi masters for the evening are:

• Anne DeCusatis (@precisememory) activates the holocron of "More Than Binary: Inclusive Gender Collection and You" 


• Chadtech (@TheRealChadtech) takes us bacta basics with "CtPaint: a clone of MSPaint in the browser"


• Willman Duffy (@willmanduffy) is yavin none of our funny title ideas in "Mountain Dew: Code Review" 

QueensJS expects all speakers and attendees to follow the JSConf code of conduct.


RSVPs, due to limited seating, will cost $5. All proceeds go towards charities that work to increase code literacy among NYC youth. There are no refunds, but you are more than welcome to transfer tickets.

If you would like to sponsor or speak at one of our events, please email us at organizers at queensjs dot com!

results.description:
Comic time! This week: Spike and Zecora, and Pinkie Pie and Celestia.  So pack your books and come over to this week's meetup for Friends Forever #21 and #22(descriptions and download links below) 

http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/mlp/images/5/54/Friends_Forever_issue_21_cover_A.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150715143741

Friends Forever #21

The issue opens with Spike racing to Zecora's hut in the Everfee Forest. He informs her that a strange sickness has left every pony in Ponyville sneezing, covered in red spots, and bedridden; for some reason, only Spike himself is immune. After arming herself with various potions and an antibacterial face mask to prevent getting infected and recruiting the help of a small bird named Avery, Zecora sets out with Spike to help.


Written by: Ted Anderson 
Artwork by: Agnes Garbowska

Download link: https://www.comixology.com/My-Little-Pony-Friends-Forever-21/digital-comic/288235

http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/mlp/images/0/08/Friends_Forever_issue_22_sub_cover.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150818040436

Friends Forever #22

Twilight Sparkle and Pinkie Pie are summoned to Canterlot, but Twilight is unsure for what purpose. Upon their arrival to Canterlot Castle, Princess Celestia tells them that her sister Luna's birthday is coming up. She tasks Twilight with making a speech for the party that celebrates Luna's accomplishments over the years, and she has Pinkie make the cake for the birthday banquet

Written by: Christina Rice  
Artwork by: Jay P. Fosgitt

Download link: https://www.comixology.com/My-Little-Pony-Friends-Forever-22/digital-comic/300460

******************************************************

results.description:
Join us on Wednesday 5/4 at 7pm for our panel discussion during NYC Design Week! Tickets will not be available at the door so please sign-up here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/fighting-fires-and-lighting-fires-balancing-productivity-and-creativity-tickets-22545904407

Fighting Fires and Lighting Fires: Balancing Productivity & Creativity

EVENT OVERVIEW
Let's be honest - the hard part isn't often getting people excited about helping their team to be more creative, innovative, or collaborative; the challenge is when everyone sits back down at their desk and falls into the cycle of endless emails, countless fires, and all those new deadlines needed yesterday. Your team working hard is critical to moving forward, but it rarely keeps an organization innovating at the pace required in today's world. In this panel, we'll hear from a group of leaders from wildly different organizations who are helping their teams to walk that line between productivity and creativity. We'll dig into:
- Defining the balance of big thinking and tactical execution for your organization
- The cultural cues, org structures, and routines that encourage both modes of working
- How to decide which projects require big thinking vs. simply need executed
- Hiring effectively for both needs
- How to measure both sides of the equation and incentivize teams accordingly
- This panel is perfect for those creative leaders responsible for driving these shifts in their organizations, or the change making intrapreneurs making it happen from the ground up. PANELISTS
Laura Willming
People Business Partner, Harry's
https://www.linkedin.com/in/lauracwillming Felicia Stingone
Chief Marketing Officer, Grind Spaces
https://www.linkedin.com/in/feliciastingone

Daniel Casey
Project Manager in the Office of the First Deputy Mayor of New York City
https://www.linkedin.com/in/daniel-casey-418aa515

WHAT THE TICKET INCLUDES
Each ticket includes access to the intimate event, a catered dinner, and beer/wine. We believe breaking bread makes for great conversations, so we'll make sure you're taken care of.

AGENDA
7:00pm | Mingling, eats, and drinks
7:30pm | Panel discussion
8:15pm | Small group breakout discussions with panelists
9:15pm | Mingling
10:00pm | Wrap-up WHAT'S THE DESIGN GYM PANEL SERIES ALL ABOUT?
Our panel series isolates topics related to bringing a culture of design thinking, creativity, and collaboration into organizations. We then pull together a group of people experiencing that topic in wildly different situations - think a bank executive + tech startup manager + mayor's office leader + hot new restaurant general manager. Finally we design the night around sharing food and drinks together to maintain loose, honest conversations and relationship building. POWERED BY THE DESIGN GYM
The Design Gym empowers people to lead design thinking in their organization. We teach workshops, build community, and spark culture change with our clients. Whether you're a leader bringing more creativity to your organization, or a change maker influencing from the bottom up, we've got the community and learning to empower you to make it happen.
results.name: Panel Event: Balancing Productivity & Creativity

group.name: The Design Gym New York City

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin

Emily Herzlin is a writer and teacher with a particular love for memoir and poetry. She received her MFA in Nonfiction from Columbia in 2012. She began practicing meditation in 2003. In college she found her way to the Interdependence Project, where she now teaches meditation courses and retreats. Emily trained in MBSR (Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction) at the University of Massachusetts Medical School. She has been teaching meditation since 2011 to groups and individuals.

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.
results.name: Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

results.description:
You’re a deep thinker, and you probably have a ton of questions about God, the Bible, and faith in general. Excellent — this is just the group for you. Whether you are a committed believer, a seeker, an agnostic or atheist, or you are a part of another faith, this is a fun and safe place to look for answers. We’ll gather for snacks, friendship, and to discuss some of the most intriguing questions out there.

Week 1: Is there evidence for God's existence?
Week 2: Is there evidence for the trustworthiness of Genesis? (Creation, Flood, Genealogies, etc.)
Week 3: Is Bible prophecy proof for the Bible?
Week 4: How do we know that Jesus was really sent from God?

Besides these four major questions, this will be a great context to bring up many of the other questions you’ve had. You'll learn of some excellent sources for finding answers, voice your thoughts, and hear the thoughts of others on these fascinating topics. Hope to see you there, and feel free to invite your friends along.

Wednesdays, 7:00-8:30pm April 13 - May 4th (4 weeks). Latecomers welcome!
Location: Midtown Manhattan, IBM Plaza (590 Madison Ave. @ 57th Street)
Contact: Beau ([masked])

#HopeHillNYC
HopeHill.com
results.name: Answering Tough Questions

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, April 27th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The new session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (April 27th - May 18th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 16-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (April 27th - May 18th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (April 26th - May 17th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

results.description:
Vlad Zamfir, a researcher with the Ethereum project, will be joining us in NYC to discuss the future of the Ethereum project. Most of Vlad's work is on Casper and Sharding.

The Ethereum protocol is a peer-to-peer network protocol that provides a public application platform, branded as "the world computer". Many upgrades to the protocol will be required to make the platform efficient, secure, and scalable. 

Casper is a security-deposit-based alternative to Satoshi Nakamoto's consensus based on proof-of-work, and is intended to increase the security and efficiency of Ethereum. Sharded blockchain architectures, if possible, will massively scale the capacity of the platform. 

This talk will give a technical overview of the current state of these solutions.
results.name: Upgrading Ethereum: Understanding Casper and Sharding

results.description:
This is the monthly in-person meetup for the Blog Writing group. 

Our meetings are meant to support and encourage members to write, post and repeat that process.

In general, every meeting will have a theme, which will be defined prior to the meeting. Example for themes might be - setting up a blog, writing style, tone, grammar etc.

In the fist part of the meeting we'll talk about the theme (we might have someone from the group leading the discussion, external speaker or just an open discussion).

At the second part of the evening, we'll read posts written by members, and share constructive feedback.

Meeting are meant to be kept small, and the number of sits is limited. Therefor, we ask that you take note of the following:

• Please RSVP only if you plan to come. 

• If you've RSVPed, but can't join after all, please turn your RSVP status to "NO". This way, other members on the whitelist will be able to attend.

• If you want to attend, but there are no sits available, add yourself to the waitlist - we'll try to accommodate waitlisted members.


Thanks.
results.name: Blog Writing - Monthly Meetup

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Under the banner Modern Days, Ancient Nights: 50 Years of African Filmmaking, the 23rd edition of the New York African Film Festival honors the legacy of Ousmane Sembene. In 1966, his seminal work Black Girl (La Noire de...) premiered at the Cannes Film Festival and ushered in the era of contemporary African cinema. The 23rd edition of the New York African Film Festival launches with a special, interactive town hall event on Sunday, May 1st at 2:00pm with the Digital Diaspora Family Reunion Roadshow, a powerful program that helps bridge perceived differences between people and transforms strangers into family.
People of all backgrounds are invited to bring family photos (on phones, Ipads, or traditional prints) for a chance to share their family stories, and in the process discover linkages that underlie our common humanity as their photos are projected on a large screen for the audience. Those who wish to come and simply watch the event as spectators are welcome too. A panel discussion with creatives of the African Diaspora will follow the DDFR program. The event is free, but seating is limited. Register for your free tickets here.
Screenings for the 23rd New York African Film Festival (NYAFF) commence at Film Society of Lincoln Center (May 4-10) before moving to Maysles Cinema (May 13-15) and Brooklyn Academy of Music's BAMcinematek (May 26-30). Tickets are on sale now for the 23rd New York African Film Festival's Opening Night Screening + Reception.
Opening Night Film
Tanna
Wednesday, May 4th at 7:00pm
Film Society of Lincoln Center
Walter Reade Theater
165 West 65th Street
Q&A with Director + Reception will follow the screening
Based on a true story and featuring members of the Yakel tribe in Vanuatu, Tanna tells the story of a young girl from one of the world's last tribal societies who breaks off an arranged marriage to run away with her lover, setting off a war that threatens the future of their people. Watch the Trailer here Buy tickets for the 2016 NYAFF Opening Night Screening +Reception Event here
General Admission tickets for the 2016 NYAFF screenings at Film Society of Lincoln Center (May 4-10) go on sale next week. Stay tuned! For the full #NYAFF23 line-up see below. For detailed information on the films and programs of this year's festival, please visit www.africanfilmny.org.
results.name: The AFRICAN FILM FESTIVAL COMES TO TOWN!

The Dating & Marriage Connect Group is for single, dating and married women. We will discuss importance of inviting God to be a part of your love story, and will delve into key Bible passages that will encourage, equip, challenge, and prepare women to enter marriage with confidence. Learn how God designed marriage to function, what character qualities to look for in finding a future husband, and how to prepare to have a thriving marriage.

We will learn from the women of Proverbs, and examine Ephesians 5, I Corinthians 7, Titus 2, I Timothy 3, I Peter 3, and many more passages.

Week One: Understanding God’s Design for Marriage

Week Two: What a Man of God Looks Like

Week Three: What a Woman of God Looks Like

Week Four: Embracing Your Singleness & Getting Ready for Marriage

results.description:
We'll meet in front of MP Taverna for a loop run along Buckout St to Mercy College, through Dobbs Ferry and back. Afterward, everyone is welcome to stop in at MP Taverna for drinks and/or eats.


Details about the run

Route: We’ll leave promptly at 7 pm from the parking lot in front of MP Taverna. We'll head south on Buckout St and Half Moon Lane and then we'll use the little wooded short cut to the Ardsley Train Station. We'll run past the station, veer right onto the lit walking path into the Mercy College campus, and through the campus, exiting on to Broadway at Landing Dr. We'll head south on Broadway and then we'll weave through Ardsley Park, taking Langdon to Belmont to Field Terrace to Osceola, before exiting right onto Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A route map is available here. 

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: MP Taverna parking lot (One Bridge St, Irvington, NY)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Dobbs Ferry Loop

results.description:
“This is the real secret of life -- to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.”


~Alan Watts

Alan Watts swirls an orange on a string and shoots an arrow high into the air before explaining why the art of living is being paid to play -- and to the extent that we feel compelled to work and survive, life becomes a drag.

Enjoy! 

"Work as Play"


</a>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YiEzxNqw6_0<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YiEzxNqw6_0">

Dearest Beloveds,

I am deeply honored and grateful to share this 10 month journey of The Path Of Love with each of you.

The Path of Love opens you to the energy of creation and calls to you to open your heart gateway to your eternal self so that you may begin to anchor all that you are upon the Earth in unconditional love and open embrace of your Divinity.

This is the creation dreaming path where you enter the void and begin to access your highest potential through an open heart. It is here that you begin to see all the possibilities that are open for you and know that each choice you make brings you close to your divine power.

It is a deep path of self discovery where all is illuminated and you are called to embrace and honour yourself deeply. The Path of Love is the road home to all that you are.

Much Love and Gratitude,

Julie

At the last event, long time member and uber beer snob, Danny, reminded me we haven't been to the greatest beer bar in NYC this year.  As that realization dawned on me, I became physically ill due to this blunder.  So lets rectify this situation and spend the holiest of Star Wars holidays at the one and only Top Hops.  For the many people in this group who have been to Top Hops, you know why we keep coming back.  For those who have yet to experience this LES beer parlor, do yourself a favor and come out.  They consistently have an impressive but select 20 beers on tap and the rear of the parlor is a like a beer store.  The catch is that you can take any of the nearly 500 bottles from the beer store and the bar will open it and pour it for you.  The beer store will make any beer geek weep for joy.  The closest subway stops are the Grand St. B D, the Delancey F, and the Essex St. J M Z.  Hope to see everyone there!

results.description:
Wednesdays, May 4, May 18, May 25, June 1, June 8, June 15 and June 22 (Optional Review Session) 

at Jewel Heart Center

REGISTER 

In this module, we will examine what samsara is and how we are stuck in it, and what nirvana is and how we can achieve it. We will also find out how we can develop the determination to be free from suffering and how we can empower ourselves with practical tools to deal with and eliminate disturbing emotions forever. We will explore such questions as: 

-What is renunciation? 

-What is liberation? 

-What is the difference between liberation and enlightenment? 

We are delighted to announce that Gen Don Handrick will lead a Q&A session in person on Wednesday, June 8.

Discovering Buddhism (DB) study groups are geared for students who wish to deepen their understanding of fundamental Buddhist concepts. Shantideva Meditation works with a version of the DB home study program, which includes transcripts of teachings by qualified Western teachers, presentations by a facilitator, discussion among peers, and guided meditations. 

Dates and Time:

Wednesdays from 7 to 9pm: May 4, 18, 25, June 1, June 8 (Q & A with Gen Don Handrick), June 15 (discussion sessions facilitated by Gus) & June 22 (Optional review session at a private home.) 

Please note: No meeting on May 11 

Suggested Donation:

Fee: $60 (or $10/session) to help support direct costs, including space rental, Dharma materials, and administration.

Shantideva Meditation Members: $54

Registration: 

Register here for this module. 

Online registration will close at 3pm on Wednesday, May 4. Walk-ins are welcome. 

About the Facilitator:

Gustavo Cutz has worked at Wisdom Publications in Boston, has been an active volunteer with Shantideva Meditation Center since 2008, and has been a facilitator for Discovering Buddhism since 2012. He also interprets/summarizes Geshe Thubten Soepa's teachings on topics such as the Four Noble Truths, the Eight Worldly Dharmas, the Six Perfections, the Eight Verses of Thought Transformation, and recently Shantideva's Guide to the Bodhisattva's Way of Life, chapters 1-3. Gus recently completed his doctorate in psychology at Long Island University and currently practices as a clinician on Long Island.
results.name: Discovering Buddhism Study Group: Samsara and Nirvana

results.description:
We all have a need to feel accepted and loved unconditionally. If your parents were not loved unconditionally, they each developed an inner child which felt unloved. This made it hard for your parents to love you the way you wanted and needed to be loved. When you were not loved unconditionally, you too developed an inner child which felt unloved.

Your needy inner child, which feels unloved, is locked into the past. It feels that the past has been difficult and painful and is afraid that the future will be the same way. It is afraid and doesn’t feel worthy.

The thoughts and beliefs of your needy inner child are based on fear, hurt and remorse. There are thoughts of self-recrimination and replaying of old programs of parental disapproval, which now manifest as self-judgment. The underlying message of your needy inner child is, “Life is a struggle." Your needy inner child believes it is a victim of the world and carries an underlying feeling of hopelessness and helplessness.

The way out of this needy inner child rut is first to gain a sense of detachment, which allows you to observe your needy inner child’s thought system in action. Whenever there is a feeling of fear or tension in your body, you can know that there is an underlying attachment or identification with a needy inner child belief system.

The first step towards healing your needy inner child is through non-judgmental observing. Observing with non-judgment and love allows you the freedom, detachment and the perspective which fosters deep healing. As you learn to be compassionate and understanding of your inner child, the journey to healing begins. If this is done consistently, the needy inner child begins to feel safe and eventually sees a new direction. As you continue this path of observing your needy inner child with love, a sense of hope that the past need not be repeated begins to emerge and a transformation occurs. You will feel more relaxed and will have a sense of trust that you are safe and loved.

In this 8-week Healing Inner Child Program that is guided by a trained facilitator, you will learn how to give your needy inner child the nurturing attention it has always wanted. As you participate in the Healing Inner Child Program, you will learn to pay attention to what your needy inner child says, thinks, feels and how it behaves. You will learn to observe it with detachment and compassion, realizing you can transform and heal it with the help of your Higher Self.

In the supportive environment of a group or one on one, you will learn that you are not alone and have a choice to perceive your situation differently. The shared experiences and activities provide a rich opportunity to release limiting fears and bring more unconditional love into your life.

Included is a workbook with eight lessons that can be a journal of your inner child healing. Weekly focus cards and a guided audio meditation (a male & female voice version) will help you bring your inner child issues to your Higher Self for transformation. What you learn can apply to any relationship — your spouse, significant other, co-worker, friend or relative.

The topics of the 8 weekly sessions are:

Nurturing Your Inner Child — Becoming Your Needy Inner Child's Nurturing ParentThe Inner Critical Parent — Replacing Self-Criticism with Self-NurturingInner Child Baggage — Recognizing & Healing Self-Destructive ThoughtsConnecting with Higher Self — Learning to Connect Your Inner Child with Inner WisdomTransforming Fear — Rocognizing Needy Inner Child Cries for LoveStop, Look & Listen — Paying Attention to Who Is in ChargeHealing Relationships — Seeing Through the Needy Inner Child to Light EssenceSimple, Uncomplicated Love — Expanding Your Identity to Being Love
results.name: FREE Intro to Healing Inner Child Workshop

results.description:
We'll cover Chapter 5, which relates causal graphical models with the classic approach of structural equation modeling.  This chapter gives some context for causality by relating it to other approaches, so we'll have a one-off meeting soon to get some other perspectives from researchers in the field!  This meeting we'll go as far into the chapter as time allows.

Do read the material before the meeting, but it's okay if you don't understand all of it! If you get stuck somewhere, make a note of where. It's likely others got stuck in the same place! Try to push through and understand as much of the rest of the material as possible. We'll try to get everyone on the same page at the meeting!

We're an extremely informal group, and the format is generally to put the book up on a screen, and talk through the material. We stop and discuss sticking points (your notes!) throughout, and dwell on definitions and theorems.

You can also ask any questions about the material in our piazza course page, using the access code stats101 ! -- and it supports latex! http://piazza.com/nyc_ml_study_group/fall2015/stats101 Recommended Pre-requisites:

• Probability Theory (intermediate): Know what a joint and conditional distribution is. Know what marginalizing is. Understand conditional independence. 

• Causality up to Sec. 5.1

• Graphical Models (intermediate): Know how to factorize a graph. Understand what it means for a distribution P to be "Markov relative to" a graph G. Understand what a "Causal Model" is. 

Analysis (intermediate): Be comfortable with product (big Pi) notation, indices, basic methods of proofs, basics of set theory, analysis notation 

Logistical Notes:

• Be sure to be on time! If you're more than 15 minutes late, you may have trouble getting in. 

• Be sure to bring ID for security! 

• There will be signs upstairs ("Math Meetup") directing you to the room.
results.name: Discuss Causality, Ch 5

results.description:
If you live in the United States, are a visa holder, a green card holder, considering citizenship or are married to someone who is in any of these categories, this presentation could prove invaluable. 

U.S. tax authorities identify people as residents or non-residents according to special parameters, which may not be obvious. How IRS reviews your status and what that means when it comes to important issues such as income tax, estate planning, life insurance, gifting, college planning etc.? How these considerations change as you may move from visa to green card to citizenship? 

We will discuss all these issues, what steps a person should take during each stage to ensure that efficient tax planning is in place and ways to avoid non-compliance. 

Presenter: Simon Brady, CFP. Mr. Brady is a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER and founder of Anglia Advisors, a personal financial planning firm specializing in addressing the unique financial planning issues faced by foreign nationals in the United States.
results.name: What Non-Citizens Need to Know About Managing Their Finances

results.description:
RAVENLOFT RETURNS!

Join us for the launch of a brand new season of D&D Encounters! Ravenloft, the classic D&D setting of gothic horror, rises from the grave as we begin with the exclusive Adventure’s League adventures leading up to Death House. This is a 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons game for 6 players. Reserving a seat is no charge, but players pay a $10 door fee. Adventurer’s League passes can be purchases for $80, which cover 10 sessions of play.

In order to RSVP, players must go to our registration page and sign up for a specific table. Be sure to read the description to find out if the table matches your experience level! Be warned that signing up on this Meetup page does NOT guarantee a player a spot at a table.

Register here: bstrat.eventsmart.com

Play begins around 7:30pm and ends at 10:30pm. Late arrivals and early exits should try to notify their DM in advance, but are rarely a problem.

We will be creating characters during this first session and then running a three-week introduction to the game, a perfect opportunity for players who are looking to begin a fresh new campaign. Players are welcome to bring ideas for their character, or even build a 1st level character in advance and help the newer members. Character sheets, pencils, paper, dice, miniatures, and battlemaps are all provided by the store; copies of rulebooks are available to borrow, but are limited by supply. Players are welcome to bring their own gaming supplies as well as snacks and beverages.

Encounters welcomes brand-new players every week, so don’t hesitate to jump into one of our Beginner-level tables with no prior RPG experience!

results.description:
Dearest friends,

Me agrada saludaros de nuevo para nuestra próxima actividad. Esta vez nos centramos en las ciencias sociales, convergiendo varias de ellas sobre el asunto de la inmigración.

¿Todavía invisibles? Pasado, presente y futuro de los inmigrantes españoles en los EEUU


Mesa redonda donde Rosalina Alcalde, James Fernández y Javier Lorenzo aportarán, con la experiencia de sus estudios científicos e históricos, visiones sobre el pasado y el presente de los inmigrantes españoles en los EEUU.

- Rosalina Alcalde, professor of sociology at Autonomous University of Barcelona and expert in recent migration movements of Spaniards to the USA.


- James Fernández, professor of Spanish at New York University, expert on migrations of Spaniards in the XIX and XX centuries and coauthor of the book Invisible Immigrants.


- Javier Lorenzo, professor of political science at Carlos III University and expert in interactions of Spanish emigrants on social networks.

Introducción a cargo de La Nacional Spanish Benevolent Society y ECUSA-NY. Debate moderado por Marea Granate NY.

Este evento es de entrada gratuita pero tiene aforo limitado. Por favor, responda este RSVP. Tras el debate habrá una recepción para los asistentes.

Actividad organizada junto con Marea Granate NY, con la colaboración de La Nacional Spanish Benevolent Society y con el patrocinio de la Fundación Ramón Areces.

La Nacional NYC

Wednesday May 4, 2016

7:00pm

¡Espero veros allí el miércoles 4 de mayo!

Adrián Soto

Science Outreach Team

ECUSA-NY
results.name: Still invisible? Past, present and future of the Spanish immigrants in the USA

results.description:
I invite you to join me Wednesday, May 4th as I bring you through a meditation that will help you connect to your true self. We will tap into your true essence so you can remember how it feels to feel good again.

Let go of judgement, complaint, worry and discover your highest self through meditation where we let go of all that does not serve and connect with your higher power.

We will weed through your stress and worry and access the place that is free from all of that. The best part is the more you meditate, the more easily you can access this place to help you get through times of stress and uncertainty.

The other day I saw a framed picture and on it had the words, "You are a masterpiece." It had me thinking.

This is true for all of us. We are all masterpieces. We were created from the Divine (or whatever you call your higher power) and came to this earth in perfect form. But what happened? Things happened to us that made us think different. We were made fun of, abused, events happened that scared us and made us think we were less than what we really are. All of these life events can make us  worry, stress, and feel sad. These thoughts and feelings dim our light and cover up who we really are. They cover up all of our potential and dim the magnificent light is within all of us.

Who would we be if we didn’t complain? What could we create? What if we didn’t have judgement and just lived authentically?

Who would we be if we didn't let life's stresses and insecurities bring us down? What would we accomplish? What would we change and let go of?

How do we get to that place? How do we uncover all of the layers to get to who we really are and tap into our beautiful essence? Well through meditation of course! (I hope you saw that coming! <3)

“Love is a force more formidable than any other. It is invisible - it cannot be seen or measured, yet it is powerful enough to transform you in a moment, and offer you more joy than any material possession could.”

Barbara de Angelis

God is Love.  Love is God.  As a creation of God we are love.  Love is the divine substance that underpins all of creation.  We express much of who we are by love and we express fear because we sense an absence of love.

Come join us as we explore what love is in our lives.

We meet every other week to talk about being gay and topics of spirituality.  This is NOT a group about religion. This is a great way to connect with other men who have an interest in spirituality. We chat about spirituality and have an opportunity to meet other gay men with similar interests. Our group is about exploring your own spirit and sharing ideas with others.

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $10.25. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

</a>

<a href="http://bookeo.com/climbrockclub?type=2126XUFJR1387C98D3A8">

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly:
[masked]


Time:
The closer to 7:15 pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

Upcoming Tasting Dates & Themes

• 4/20/16 - Tour of Italian Wines (From Rome to Verona)

• 5/4/16 - Wines of the Spanish Diaspora

• 6/1/16 - Big Red Wines & BBQ

Admission: $15

Directions:  NJ Transit to Newark Penn Station or Broad Street Station.

From Newark Penn Station: Take the Light Rail to NJ PAC/Center Street and walk approximately 2 blocks West to the corner of Central & Halsey Street (cross Broad Street). Turn left onto Halsey and walk to the Artisan Collective, located at 25 Halsey Street.

From Broad Street: Take the Light Rail to Washington Park.  Turn right onto Washington Street, then left onto Halsey Street.  Walk 1.5 blocks South on Halsey Street (cross Central Ave) to the Artisan Collective, located at 25 Halsey Street.

results.description:
Next on the chopping block - Jean Rhys' Voyage in the Dark:

"It tells of the semi-tragic descent of its young protagonist Anna Morgan, who is moved from her Caribbean home to England by an uncaring stepmother, after the death of her father. Once she leaves school, and she is cut off financially by the stepmother, Hester, Anna tries to support herself as a chorus girl, then becomes involved with an older man named Walter who supports her financially. When he leaves her, she begins a downward spiral. The novel is rich in Caribbean folklore and tradition and post-colonial identity politics, including black self-identification by its white protagonist."

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one?  Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

Your next level of success is accelerated and within your reach when you work with our group. We are for those who want something more, something different, or something bigger in their career, finances, and business.
