results.description:
Having trouble fully absorbing A Course in Miracles (ACIM) or another non-dualistic spiritual tradition? Then A COURSE OF LOVE may be just for you! Channeled by the same voice that authored ACIM but in more easy to understand and feminine language, Mari Perron’s A Course of Love speaks to the heart rather than the mind. Let’s explore this important new text together and use it as a springboard to become peaceful miracle workers. 

Led by CRS co-founders and ACIM Teachers/Healers Yasuko Kasaki and Christopher Pelham, this class work its way through the text week by week. 

In our May 4 meetup we'll be reading chapter 14. You can read it online here:

http://acourseoflove.com/Images/FREE-ACOL-to-chapter-20.pdf

You can easily order the book online from Amazon or BN.com, and e-book versions are available.

It may be astonishing to hear that there is a “continuation” of A Course in Miracles, but it is true. Forty years ago Jesus dictated ACIM to the scribe Helen Schucman. More recently, over three years, he similarly dictated A Course of Love. Jesus himself referred to what he was dictating as a “continuation of A Course in Miracles.” Students of ACIM will recognize the Voice. Students of truth, whatever their background, will find that ACOL resonates with the heart.

A Course of Love builds upon the same non-dualistic thought system as ACIM, yet it is a course for the heart. ACOL and ACIM work hand-in-hand. Yet remarkably, ACOL bypasses the mind. It uses thought to go beyond thought. Those yearning to access the heart’s knowing will find help here. This is your invitation to live the purposeful, meaningful life of the new—the reality of heaven on earth.

Wednesday nights from 8 – 9:30 pm at CRS
Classes are $20 and class cards are available.

results.description:
Jim and James have been working on a controller to drive 2 different color filaments through a single 3D printer extruder head.

That part of things seems to be working. They've got parts on order that will allow them to expand this to 3 filaments, opening up the possibility for 3D printing in arbitrary colors or having arbitrary color gradients in a 3D print. (by mixing cyan, magenta and yellow filaments in varying amounts)

Rich plans on revisiting a plan to put a HAM radio antenna on his house.

... and many thanks go to Ephraim for provisioning us with the barbeque ribs that made the previous meeting's barbeque recap a huge success.

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8:30-10:30pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
This presentation will cover deep dive into fault tolerant HDFS file operators, and extending Yahoo! streaming benchmarks to Apache Apex (next generation native Hadoop platform that does both streaming and batch, and is commonly used for big data ingestions and transformations) 

Agenda:

9:15pm: Deep dive into how operators read from and write to files for exactly-once semantics - Chandni Singh, committer Apache Apex 

10:00pm: Q&A 

10:15pm: Extending Yahoo Streaming computation Benchmark to Apache Apex - Sandesh Hegde, committer Apache Apex 

Abstract: 

Talk #1: Deep dive into how operators reads and writes from/to files in an idempotent manner. This will cover file input operator, file splitter, block reader on the input side and file output operator on the output side. We will present how these operators are made scalable and fault tolerant with the hooks provided by Apache Apex platform. 

Talks #2: Extending Yahoo Streaming computation Benchmark to Apache Apex 

- Application topology 

- Comparison of results between Storm, Flink and Apex 

- Variation of the Apex Benchmarking App with event time and 'results query' support 

- Demo 

Please register for Fault Tolerant HDFS r/w with Apache Apex; and Apex (native Hadoop) benchmarks on May 4, 2016 at: https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/8175875379681147652

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the webinar.

@ApacheApex, meetup presentations, meetup recordings, download, Apache Apex releases, docs

This webcast is of an Hadoop Ingest and Transform meetup event in another city (2833 Junction Ave, #200, San Jose, CA), we are webcasting it enable other Big Data Ingesters to participate. If you are interested in helping organize (hosting, presenting, community leadership) Hadoop Ingest & Transform community, please email [masked]
results.name: Fault Tolerant HDFS r/w with Apache Apex; and Apex (native Hadoop) benchmarks

results.description:
-NEW MEMBER WELCOME- 


What is J-Kuru?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5we0xkpiKGA&feature=youtu.be

Come seize the day with us over a cup of coffee, a danish, and Japanese conversation at our early morning events! 

These casual gatherings are open for all levels of Japanese. We'll chat about a wide range of topics, from talking about daily life, to comparing our different cultures, and sharing tips we've learned while studying foreign languages.

！！！　Please RSVP　！！！

(Don't worry if RSVP's are low--we have members coming every day, so someone will always be there to meet you!)


Please check out our FACEBOOK page for event info and fun photos!

We look forward to meeting you soon!

J-KURU

That's the question we'll be discussing over breakfast with James Tagg, Author of "Are The Androids Dreaming Yet," Inventor of the LCD Touchscreen and co-founder of Truphone.

PLEASE REGISTER HERE

Join us on May 5th for a Breakfast Briefing to talk about Artificial Intelligence and discuss if (and when!) our smartphones will be smarter than us.

Expect a romp through the short-term practical things we will see our mobiles do, through to some future-gazing speculation for one of the most inventive minds in the mobile business.

This is a FREE event and breakfast will be provided.

results.description:
Hello NYC Internetworkers!

We’re excited to announce the first Internet Architecture & Engineering Meetup (#iaenyc) will be on Thursday, May 5th at 9AM, at Intergate.Manhattan in Chinatown.

We’re looking forward to welcoming Peter Hack, Senior Solutions Engineer at Dynatrace Ruxit. He will review liquid infrastructure monitoring and walk through the pains felt by Ops teams in understanding where containers are running and whether they're running well. We’ll look at: Why using Docker orchestration changes the way you see your applications; How traditional monitoring tools don't float in liquid infrastructure; and what else monitoring can reveal about our container-based infrastructure.

If you have any specific questions about monitoring that you’d like Peter to address in his presentation, please post them in the comments!

Agenda:

9:00 - 9:15 - Social

9:15 - 9:20 - George Panagiotou - Sabey introduction

9:20 - 9:30 - Nich Chung - Community introduction

9:30 - 10:00 - Peter Hack - Monitoring Liquid Infrastructure: Swarm, Mesos, Kubernetes, and beyond.

10:00 - 10:30 - Social / Wrap-up


Bio

Peter is a Senior Solutions Engineer for Dynatrace Ruxit. He has a strong background in operations and infrastructure having experience from regulated Financial Institutions IT and global software engineering to startups and DevOps. A man of many hats, Peter is a VMware VCP and virtualization junky but his passion is to travel the world (again) and always experience new things... tech or otherwise.


Bio


George is the Director of Leasing for Sabey Data Centers and has initiated Sabey’s entry into the retail colocation market by creating its Ready to Rack bundled colocation solution. With over 20-years’ experience in Enterprise sales and sales management, primarily in colocation, cloud and managed services, George has assembled and managed several successful sales teams. 

Location/Instructions:

Our friends at Sabey have offered to provide space for this upcoming event. Please make sure to bring photo ID.

The address is:

375 Pearl Street  
26th Floor
New York, NY 10038

results.description:
LEADER:  Fred Hodde ([masked] or[masked](h)/ 973-[masked](c))

RATING: B 6.5 B

Please arrive 15 minutes early for introductions and to get situated.  Meet at the Lake Skannatati Parking Area at 9:30 AM. The planned route will use the ASB, Red Cross, Beech and Long Path Trails. Call cell before 9AM if the weather is questionable. TC Northern Harriman map 119.

Note that this hike is part of a larger group, the NJR ADK. Most hikers sign up via our printed schedule (see below) and not through Meetup, so though the number of attendees may appear small, we generally have a group of 10-20 on any given hike.


*   *   *   *   *   *


 Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance: Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B 7 A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.

results.description:
Thursday, May 5, 2016 Field Trip, 12 Noon—Van Cortlandt Park, Bronx, NY

We were at the southern most point of the Big Apple several weeks ago with our field trip to Tottenville, Staten Island.  Now, let's head northwest to Van Cortlandt Park and explore this oasis in the Bronx.  

Van Cortlandt Park is a natural showcase featuring the last vestiges of New York City's native woodlands,  1,146 acres cover the  ridges and valleys of the Northwest Bronx and is the city’s third largest park. Van Cortlandt  was established as a park in 1888 and has the oldest house in the Bronx as well as the borough’s largest freshwater lake.  Its upper basin can be appreciated from the Van Cortlandt Golf Course  which itself made history as the nation's first municipal golf course when it opened in 1895.  Van Cortlandt Park is also home to the Van Cortlandt House Museum, Van Cortlandt Nature Center, and a number of amenities such as various sports fields, running trails, a multi-use stadium, a pool, and the Riverdale Stables.

Around 20,000 years ago, New York was buried beneath massive glaciers. When the ice receded, it left behind the characteristic sketch of Van Cortlandt Park—steep ridges, gradual hills, and open flats—and exposed its three major rock components: Fordham Gneiss, Inwood Dolomite, and Manhattan Schist. It took about seven thousand years for Paleo–Indians to arrive in this area, following mastodon, giant beaver, and caribou across North America.


By 1000 AD, Woodland Indians known as the Lenape began permanent settlements from lower New York State through Delaware. The Wiechquaskeck Lenapes occupied this site, settling into an agricultural lifestyle. They hunted in wooded uplands, fished in Tibbetts Brook, farmed on the Parade Ground and Indian Field and foraged through meadows and forests for nuts, fruits and other edible plants.

In 1639, the Dutch East India Company brought the first Europeans to settle in the Bronx, purchasing most of today’s Bronx County from the local Natives and, in 1646, sold it to Holland native Adriaen Van Der Donck, who became the first single owner of what is now Van Cortlandt Park. His vast estate “de Jonkeerslandt“ gave Yonkers its name. The land passed through several families, each gradually developing it into viable farmland and a working plantation.

The Van Cortlandt name was first associated with the tract of land bounded by modern Yonkers City Line between Broadway, Jerome Avenue, and Van Cortlandt Park East in 1694, when Jacobus Van Cortlandt bought the property. During the 1690s, he dammed Tibbetts Brook to create the 16–acre lake to power a gristmill. The Van Cortlandt Mansion was built in 1748 by his son, Frederick Van Cortlandt, whose family occupied the land until the 1880s. Frederick also established the family burial plot on Vault Hill where, at the onset of the American Revolution, City Clerk Augustus Van Cortlandt hid the city records from the British Army.

For more info see: http://www.vcpark.org/

We’ll meet at the front of the #1 Train’s northbound platform at the 96th Street station (Broadway and West 96th Street) at 12 Noon and ride until the 242 St. Van Cortlandt Park Station.  Alternatively, the Bx9 travels along Broadway on the western edge of Van Cortlandt Park. 

RSVP at right.  There is no charge for this event!

At the field trip's end, we'll gather for a bite to eat or a beverage (Optional and dutch).

This will be a brief introduction to static tech and a preview of my Saturday Jekyll Conference talk for members of the Civic Hall community. I should have a limited number of spots to non-members, so only RSVP if you are quite sure you'll make it.

Description:

Static sites can be for more than simple blogs and brochureware, and in fact, Jekyll enables rich, flexible, and complex content strategies that in some ways eclipse the abilities of a traditional database-driven site. This talk will explore: 


1) Using all the content types in Jekyll to be DRY and logical.2) The importance of an editor for stability/conciseness. 

3) User-driven design without the limitations of a database.

This will be a brief introduction to static and a preview of my upcoming Saturday talk

This 60 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program. We will explore breath and meditation as well as other tools which are taught on the Happiness Program. 

 Please arrive early for seating and registration

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.

results.description:
Meet at 4:00 pm.

Ride at 4:15 pm

IF A SECOND GROUP WANTS TO MEET LATER, perhaps someone can volunteer to lead a second group.  Please post through comments.

Meet at small parking lot off of College Road (University Drive.)

Intermediate level ride; no beginners please.

Most fun trails are unmarked.  Ride is not super fast. May ride to the top depending upon group.

Map of Park: http://www.wpunj.edu/dotAsset/325914.pdf

Park Website: http://www.nynjtc.org/park/high-mountain-park-preserve

A description from mtbNJ "with lots of loose rock, and rock garden too and lots of climbing, lesser flowy trails hence the rocks. This trails will make you hate or love. There's some nice single track too."

Note:  Can get there from Hamburg Tpk in Wayne to University Drive  at a light (Turn left) or

From 287 to Route 208 S, Take Ewing Ave Exit and travel S to T (stop sign), Turn L onto High Mt Road.  Stay on High Mt Road to fork, keep right to stay on High Mt Road.   At next traffic light, make a right.  At stop sign, this is College Road, turn right.  Parking lot is up a ways on the right.

results.description:
Join us as we kick-off the Spring 2016 HITLAB Seminar Series with: 

Jeff Dachis

CEO & Founder, One Drop

Former Chairman, CEO, Razorfish

TBA

5/5/[masked] pm

Mailman School of Public Health Auditorium, Floor R8

722 W 168th St, New York, NY 10032

**Join us afterwards for Coogans HITLAB Happy Hour! First 25 seminar attendees receive a free drink voucher.**

Type 1 LADA since September, 2013

Low carb, Pescatarean.  Skier, Runner, Cyclist.  DJ. West Side Story fanatic. Cheese lover.

Proud father of 2, lucky husband to 1.

I started One Drop because when I found out I had diabetes, I was shocked at how behind the times diabetes care was. All the energy seemed to be focused on managing problems versus preventing them in the first place.  I wanted to do something about it and work with an amazing team to bring the quantified self movement, internet of things, big data, and mobile computing to people with diabetes in a simple, fully integrated solution.

One Drop is for me, my family, and our future.  One Drop is from Informed Data Systems Inc.

Diabetes is hard, it doesn’t have to be.

results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
This group isn't your typical 'networking' event:  Our focus is helping each other grow our businesses through mastermind/brainstorming.  We are building business through building relationships with each other, so we can help each other succeed.

Here is an example of a typical Mastermind meeting:

5:30pm – Open mix and mingle (15 minutes)

5:45-6:30pm – Mastermind: 4-5 individuals at about 8 minutes each (45 minutes)

6:30-6:45pm – Connection/Business needs requests (15 minutes)

6:45-7:00pm - Open networking (will sometimes go past 7pm if space allows)

It's a 'smallish' event with between 4-12 in attendance, so we have the time and environment to get to know each other.  Plus, it's relaxed and enjoyable, so join us!

Attendance costs $5 - you can pay here in Meetup when registering - or pay at the door.  We ask that you RSVP in advance, as we don't want to turn anyone away due to our space constraints.  We only have 12 chairs, so come early!

Please take a moment to read "About us" at the top left so you get to know what we're all about before you RSVP.
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the dedicated parking lot in the back of the building, off of Cook Ave., then walk to the front of the building and come in the lobby door.
results.name: Monthly Mastermind

results.description:
Thursday, May 5, 2016

5:30 – 8:30PM

Next week the Mid Atlantic Bio Angels will be back at The Institute for Life Science Entrepreneurship for NJ 1st Pitch Life Science!

The event is FREE!  We still need you to register!

http://1stpitchnjmay2016.eventbrite.com

With an exciting lineup of companies and over 100+ registered attendees – You won’t want to miss it!


Prevnos makes Hybrid Fusion FISH™ assays for cancer diagnostics in clinical and research settings.

Novanex is a clinical stage company pursuing a new non-invasive glucose monitoring device for diabetes patients using a unique metabolic heat conformation method.

Quanz Data Solutions provides intuitive and interactive SaaS to analyze and visualize clinical data for the pharmaceutical industry.

Hear what happens behind closed doors after a start-up company presents to an investor group! Usually after the company representatives leave the room, the investors have a private discussion to decide whether the opportunity merits further investigation and possible investment.  1st Pitch Life Science offers presenters and audience members the chance to hear what happens in those closed-door discussions, and to learn what really matters to investors. 1st Pitch Life Science (<a>1stpitchlifescience.com</a>)is organized by MABA (Mid Atlantic Bio Angels - <a>bioangels.net</a>), a life science investor group, to encourage and educate aspiring life science entrepreneurs who know they may be too early to seek investment but want the opportunity to practice their pitch and to receive constructive criticism from experienced and knowledgeable professionals.

When:  Thursday, May 5, 2016

  5:30pm – Registration & Networking

  6:00 – 8:00pm – Program

  8:00 – 8:30pm – Networking

Where:  ILSE (Institute for Life Science Entrepreneurship)

1075 Morris Avenue, STEM Bldg.
Union, New Jersey 07083

ILSE is conveniently located on the campus of Kean University, with easy access to the Garden State Parkway, NJ Turnpike and NJ Transit rail lines (with connections to NYC and Newark Penn Stations). 

*Limit 125 attendees.  Must pre-register to attend. Please make sure to Un-RSVP if you cannot attend.

You are invited to join us on Thursday May 5th @ Sky Room, NYC's Highest Luxury Rooftop Bar & Lounge!!!


Doors open at 5pm (our Meetup officially starts @ 6pm), so feel free to get there early and mingle by the bar & throughout the rooftop with the our Black and Latino professionals that will be in attendance.

Please note the details below:

• Admission is FREE for you and your guests I (You MUST tell the doorman that you are on the Black/Latino Afterwork Drinks Meetup Guest list to get in with Free admission)

• Happy Hour Drinks Specials until 7pm include: $5 Beer, $7 Wine & Cocktails

• Food Happy Hour until 7pm

CINCO DE MAYO SPECIALS

$6 Margaritas until 10pm


• We will be sitting in the VIP section of the club. This will be our "home base" for the evening, but we are free to mingle throughout the rest of the venue

results.description:
Real estate is facing a rising tide of consumer expectations and interest in how goods are made. Interest in transparency and disclosure is sparking new conversations for owners and designers around where building products and materials come from, what's in them, and what their ingredients mean for occupants.

At Unpacking Product Ingredients, participants will learn the intricacies of product labeling, including how to interpret transparency documents, how emissions testing and certification systems affect indoor air quality, and how to extract useful information from Health Product Declarations, Cradle to Cradle Material Health Certificates, Declare labels, Pharos profiles, and Safety Data Sheets. We'll even test drive the material selection process for a few products, and discuss how to use these to make informed decisions.

- Click Here to Register -
results.name: Unpacking Product Ingredients: What’s in a Label? (UGC & NYPH Event)

group.name: NY Passive House (NYPH) Meetup: New York City

results.description:
THIS PAGE HAS IMAGES,  if you do not see them and you are viewing this page with


1)  the Meetup App - click the "DESCRIPTION TAB"

2) Android - open your browser's settings menu and click ''REQUEST DESKTOP SITE". 

3) Apple IOS - click the "DESKTOP SITE" button at the bottom of the page.

4) Microsoft Windows - buy a new computer :)

For those new to the Hop you might be wondering how you will find the group. Well below is a lovely vid of myself. Study my face carefully and commit it to memory. Now that I am burned into your hippocampus simply look for me loitering in the lobby of 529 West 20th Street.

https://vimeo.com/161663358

Every week I receive emails from new members asking if there is a fee to join or attend the Thursday Night Gallery Hop. So rather than answer each email individually I'll kill a whole flock of birds with one stone. 

THE HOP IS, ALWAYS HAS BEEN, AND WILL REMAIN COMPLETELY FREE 

That said if you would like to help offset my organizer fees or buy me a post-hop bourbon you are more than welcome to click the 'chip in' button on the left side of this page. But let me reiterate contributions while appreciated are NOT required. 

And now the openings...

Pablo Atchugarry


Hollis Taggart Galleries

521 West 26th Street, 7th Floor

Amelia Peláez, Loló Soldevilla and Zilia Sánchez 


Galerie Lelong

528 West 26th Street

Lucia Love & Motohiko Odani

Albertz Benda

515 West 26th Street

Juan Uslé


Cheim & Read

547 West 25th Street

Beatrice Scaccia


Cara Gallery

508 West 24th Street 

Cindy Sherman


Metro Pictures

519 West 24th Street

Felix Gonzalez-Torres

Andrea Rosen Gallery

525 West 24th Street

Desire Obtain Cherish


UNIX Gallery

532 West 24th Street

James Turrell & Richard Tuttle

PACE

534 West 25th Street

After the openings (around 8 pm) everyone who would like to continue with the group are welcome to join us at a nearby restaurant (location TBD) for refreshments and general merriment. 


See you at the Hop

Todd

results.description:
Today's Inspired Latina - Volume II

248 Pages | 26 Stories | 1 Dream In Common

Join us As We Celebrate The Amazing Stories Of Latinas From Around The Country At The MIAMI Book Launch for Today's Inspired Latina Vol I. It's an Evening of Inspiration and Motivation to Empower our Community. Author Presentations, Book Signing and Powerful Networking. REGISTER TODAY: http://TodaysLatina.com/book-launch/

Thursday, May 5th 6:00pm to 9:00pm

Today’s Inspired Latina is a book of inspiration and hope, a poignant collection of personal stories that will activate your passion.  These are success stories that need to be told, to motivate our community and generations to come. By overcoming language barriers, self-doubts and other obstacles in their way, these strong Latinas are a great example of how inspiration and perseverance can lead you to happiness and success in business and life. It’s a positive, empowering read for anyone sitting on a dream and thinking it can’t come true. Today’s Inspired Latina shows that it can!

We Look Forward To Seeing You There!
results.name: Today's Inspired Latina Volume II - Chicago Book Launch

results.description:
La Petite Taste is an experiential Caribbean-fusion gluten free catering company that believes health of the mind, body, and soul is the truest forms of wealth. This Cinco de Mayo, join La Petite Taste at a *secret location* for the "La Petite Taste of Art" event which brings together all forms of art that stimulate all the senses including the sixth. At this event, you will experience the many facets of our creativity expressed through art, music and food. With the mixture of gluten-free Caribbean-fused tacos/tapas, *tea infused* margaritas, DJ spinning feel-good music and stimulating art; your mind, body, and soul will leave rejuvenated. results.description:
Come celebrate Small Business Week with us, Kiva NYC and Councilman Robert Cornegy Jr., chairman of the Committee on Small Business and the NYC Council representative of the Beford Stuyvesant and Crown Heights communities of Brooklyn.  


You'll have the chance to hear from a panel of entrepreneurs from Brooklyn about their experience growing their business and accessing capital.  There will be a brief "class" on all forms of the capital ladder (crowdfunding, microloans, bank loans, equity investment, etc) followed by a panel discussion with baller local business owners such as Stevenson of The Bishop Gallery, Kawana of Sweet Brooklyn, Rotimi of Bed-Vyne, and Tiffany Joy of TJ Murchinson & Co Media Boutique.  If your a business owner, start up, or even just a neighbor, you can learn how to approach your own growth from these stories!

When: May 5, 6:00p.m. - 8:00p.m.

Where: Bedford Hall, 1177 Bedford Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11216

Join us for a special, two-hour networking and workshop event for veteran business owners during National Small Business Week at the Microsoft Store.

This free event will include:

·  A streaming event from our New York City Flagship Store entitled “Small Business, Big Ideas; Live Expert Q&A” with Carol discuss how to elevate your leadership skills from good to great, the best ways to lead and grow your small business, including tips to empower employees, embrace change, manage resources and create a loyal customer base. They will also answer live Tweets from around the country on your most pressing business questions.

· Keynote speaker, Phillip J. Doyle, owner of 27-7 Networking Sales, LLC.

·  An opportunity to network with other local business owners

·  A look at the many free resources and services available to business customers

As a thank you for attending the event, you will receive a coupon for a 10% discount on Surface devices*. Bring a friend, enjoy great savings, and learn how you can enhance your business with services and solutions from Microsoft.

Register today as space is limited.

*Offer valid from May 1, 2016 to May 7, 2016. Offer is available while supplies last. Available in Microsoft retail and online store in the United States (including Puerto Rico) only. Only valid for Customers who attend SMB Week event and present flyer. Limits and exclusions apply.  Not valid on prior orders or purchases; cannot be transferred or otherwise redeemed for cash or coupon code(s).  Combinable with Essentials bundles, not combinable with Student or Military; may not combinable with other offers. Non-stackable with any other offers.  Refunds will take into account the discount. Price discount does not include taxes, shipping or other fees. Void where prohibited or restricted by law. results.description:
Graybar Toastmasters is open to all who wish to improve their public speaking and leadership skills. In addition, this is a great way to network with a dynamic and diverse group of professionals.

Founded in 1954, we are one of the oldest Toastmasters clubs in New York City. We are a friendly club with members dedicated to helping each other become better speakers.

We meet from 6:15pm to 8:15pm on the 1st and 3rd Thursdays of each month in the same location. 

Our meetings are structured to allow everbody participate, practice and learn.

In our meetings the members of the club take different roles that allow them to practice and improve their public speaking and leadership skills by completing different projects.

The different roles include giving prepared presentations, chairing the meeting, improvising a short speech, telling a joke, giving feedback to speakers, evaluating the whole meeting, among others, all in a very friendly and supportive environment.

People who RSVP this meetup attend as guests. They introduce themselves at the beginning of the meeting and give feedback at the end, and some of them may participate in an improv exercise, this is an opportunity for you to check out the club coming to one or a couple of meetings, and decide if you want to join as an active member. 

To learn more about Toastmasters International please visit http://www.toastmasters.org/

See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: 28 East 35th Street, between Park and Madison in New York City. To enter, please press buzzer #2 outside the red door for the Gallery/Lounge on the 1st Floor. PLEASE attend the meeting only if you RSVP since the space available is limited.
results.name: Graybar Toastmaster meeting!

results.description:
Since 2011, our group has expanded to several hundred real estate investors who are constantly learning & earning together in NYC. Come and meet our EPIC Community of Local Real Estate Investors, build your network, and learn why real estate is IDEAL and why you should be involved with our community of real estate investors. 

Within our real estate investing community, we help train people with no experience to professionals who have been working in the real estate field for many years. So No license or experience is necessary, and if you are a professional, you are more than welcome to join us and learn how we create successful network of educated real estate investors.

Real Estate can be a very risky business which is why you need to network with other local educated investors, get educated yourself so you can invest in real estate, learn to save money on taxes, and build wealth. The bigger our community is, the more we can network and work together!

At this meeting we talk about the biggest money making opportunities (Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy & Holds, Seller Financed Notes + Tax Liens/Deeds, Multi-Family/Commercial and Money Lending) for a Real Estate Investor in today’s market. You will get to learn about members that are investing in real estate and making $10,000-$100,000+ per real estate transaction, and we will also talk about how you can make  upto $10k per referral helping our community grow. 


To attend, simply RSVP & answer the registration questions for location!If you would like to bring a friend or business partner with you to the meeting, please email us their name, email address and phone number so that we can make sure they are registered for the meeting.
results.name: Learn About Our E.P.I.C. Real Estate Investing Community

group.name: The NYC Real Estate Investors Success Meetup Group

results.description:
***NOTE*** This group is currently nearly full. We are accepting one more player on a first-come, first served basis. This is subject to change quickly and I apologize if I can’t accommodate you in this game when you do reach out to me.


INTRODUCTION:Until just days ago, most members of our party were blissfully unaware of the Keys of Power and their creator, the Aramago. Even those that had any inkling of these topics thought the stories they’d heard to be mere legends. Then one of the Keys of Power was almost literally dropped in their lap. They were suddenly running for their lives guarding Melrick, the courier ferrying that item to a safe place.


Now, Melrick is dead and the party is cast adrift in an alien realm of existence. What’s worse, they’ve been separated from more than half of their number with seemingly no hope to reunite with them. So Theron, Clovis, and Drom cast about for ways to return to their home plane, reunite with their comrades, and most importantly, convey the precious cargo they carry to its rightful place.


However, all is not lost. Potential new allies have stepped forward. Already the elven ranger Thamior has shown his worth by warning the party of an impending ambush and nearly dying in helping to fight it off. And he’s introduced them to two more he knows can be trusted once the four of them reach the tiny village they hope will be a safe haven. They have just begun to relax for a much-needed warm meal when a gypsy strolls into the tavern and engages them directly with a desperate plea for help.


BACKGROUND:"The Keeper of the Keys" is a home-brewed, Dungeons and Dragons campaign. It is a shell that encompasses the numerous, separate adventures the players will enjoy during an epic quest to recover all the Keys of Power.


This game is one of two, biweekly games I am running in the Central Jersey D&D MeetUp group under the banner of “Adventures in Azocar”. It meets on the second and fourth Thursdays of each month. We may also have additional meetings if there’s a fifth Thursday in any given month but mostly, this will probably be kept open for make-up games.


I am looking for a group of players willing to commit to the schedule I propose; players whose attendance will not be an issue. These players also need to be ready to be involved in a long-running game. I know this because each time I've run "The Keeper of the Keys", it's encompassed almost the entirety of the PC's lifespan as adventurers.
results.name: The Keeper of the Keys - An Azocar Adventure

Yes, that iPhone that you have in your pocket has a great camera! But have you ever wondered how much more you can do with it? Today's smart phones are much more than a ""point and shoot camera"". Why not take full advantage of it? 


This 2 hour classes will teach you how to maximize the potential of these devices and what you can do with some of its most popular photo apps. You will learn how to effectively work around some of its limitations and increase your iPhone's potential! You will be amazed (and so will your friends!). Don't wait any longer phones are getting better and smarter! .

Please ONLY RSVP if you will be attending.  If you cannot attend and already have RSVP'd, please unRSVP so someone can replace you.  These classes are very popular and we want to be as fair as possible.

The Consulate General of India, New York and the Art of Living Foundation are partnering to bring ‘Meditation Happy Hour’ to the community every other Thursday. A unique opportunity for you to experience stillness in the city that is always ON. Leveraging the ancient techniques of yoga, breath and meditation, the 60 minute session will allow you to go beyond daily mental stresses and help you recharge yourself and tap into greater happiness, purpose, creativity & intuition.

This 60-minute free meditation class is open for people with any or no experience with meditation, yoga or breathing.

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F23qjR9I9RE


What is Inner Engineering?


Inner Engineering is a method, a tool to engineer a deep and lasting personal transformation.


It is a combination of methods and technologies derived from the ancient science of yoga.


It is a comprehensive system addressing every aspect of human wellbeing – from body, mind and emotion to the fundamental life energy within us.


Over two million people have completed the “Inner Engineering” program worldwide and have reported remarkable results. The program includes engaging discourses exploring the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life situations, along with guided meditations, group discussions, simple yoga postures, and a powerful and purifying energy technique designed to bring one’s entire system into alignment and harmony.


What does the program offer?


Enlightening interactive sessions, guided meditations, asanas, simple yoga postures Shambhavi Mahamudra, a powerful , 21-minute energy technique that brings your entire system into alignment so that your body, mind, emotions and energies function in harmony


Benefits


- Improved mental clarity,sleep quality, and increased energy levels. Ability to handle stressful situations effortlessly


- Deepening of interpersonal relationships, thus cultivating a greater sense of connectivity at home, work and in the community


- Helps to purify the five elements (earth, water, fire, air, space) in the body leading to pleasantness in the body, mind and emotion


- Relief from chronic ailments


- Access to the intelligence and competence within, which is the very source of creation Greater peace and joy in everyday life


Who Should Attend?


- The program is for anyone age 14+, with no requirements of previous experience or physical agility. This is not about becoming strong or learning to stand on your head, but it is a technology for looking at the fundamentals of your life and nurturing your complete wellbeing. The technology of Inner Engineering is like driving a car – no matter what your background, beliefs, religion, or culture, if you learn to drive the car properly, it will take you places!

Register: https://www.innerengineering.com/live/events/newyork/

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.
results.name: THURSDAY NIGHT CO-ED INDOOR FUTSAL Game

results.description:
Title:

Accelerated Win10 Migrations

Speaker:

 Jerome Barnes - http://www.1e.com

Abstract:

 Windows 10 brings a range of new capabilities to an enterprise, including essential new security features to ensure data is protected, and greater agility to succeed in today’s digital world.  However, Windows 10 also brings a new set of challenges, from enabling the new security features to a new Microsoft servicing model that needs careful planning before the migration begins. 

Jerome Barnes, 1E Solution Engineer and Windows Migration expert, will provide vital information about Windows 10 deployment and management using ConfigMgr, including important considerations you need to cover in your planning, what the new security features mean to your migration, and information about upgrade scenarios, limitations and troubleshooting – putting you in the driving seat of your Windows 10 project.

As usual, we'll have Pizzas and Beverages, offered by 1E.

See you there
results.name: Accelerated Windows 10 Migrations (Hosted by 1E)

results.description:
Come play baseball! The Casual Baseball Club is open to all baseball fans and players who want a nice way to practice baseball without the competition or time of a league.

We'll have equipment for some infield practice, throwing, tee work/soft toss, talking about the Mets - whatever you're interesting in to enjoy the game we love. You can find us in the East River Park Fields, right across from 2nd street on the East side. You can cross over at 6th St. or Houston St. Look for a red batting net, we may be anywhere in the space depending on availability.

All experiences levels welcome, bring your own gloves. We hope to see you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be somewhere on the field with a net and Mets gear. Call me at [914-548-9286] if you can't find us!

results.description:
This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

Here's a photo of the area where we meet, for reference:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

 

==> Learning & Practice RESOURCES

Various materials http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/thread/3199165/0#[masked]

KANJI http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1175397
KATAKANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198386
HIRAGANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198387

Please click over DISCUSSIONS ->Message Board, then select your favorite topic. Have a lot of FUN learning about Nihon & Nihongo! http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me, with the pile of Japanese dictionaries at one of the tables in the Atrium, or one of the other groups speaking in and about Japanese.
results.name: Weekly Japanese Study Group

results.description:
Would you like to meet a group of local successful Real Estate investors who are reaping all the benefits of a once in a lifetime buyers market?

At this meeting we will discuss why there are more millionaires created through real estate than all other industries combined. Right now we're in a once in a lifetime Real Estate buyers market which is helping to fuel our expansion. The combination of record low mortgage rates and underpriced housing values is why our group is making a killing in this market. Even the "world's greatest Investor" Warren Buffet is advising people to buy real estate.

Being that seating is limited please answer the RSVP questions and provide your full name, phone number and email address. 

You will have the opportunity to:

• Network with a local group of successful Real Estate Investors.

• Learn how rental properties are one of the best tax saving strategies out there. 

• Discuss the biggest money making opportunities in today's market: Short Sales, Lease Options, Fix and Flips, Foreclosures, Seller Financed Notes, and Multi-Family Dwellings.

• Learn how to be your own boss. 

• Learn how to build massive wealth strategies such as Fix and Flips and passive wealth with Rental Properties.

• And so much more

We will show you a few deals we've completed recently & explain how you can be included in the deals we have going forward. We will also show you how can become part of our network and be coached and mentored by seasoned real estate mentors so you can complete deals of your own. Each meeting is different as we discuss different deals we've closed.

Some of our members invest part time for residual income while others have been able to FIRE THEIR BOSS to invest full time. If you are interested in learning how to make consistent $10,000 or more per month please register for this event. We have a wide network of Real Estate Investors local to the NY Metro Area that will show you how.

Being that seating is limited please answer the RSVP questions and provide your full name, phone number and email address.
results.name: Free Real Estate Investing Workshop

results.description:
Inner Engineering is a resource that can help with your self-help and self-improvement journey whether you are a veteran or a beginner. Sadhguru, a yogi and mystic, and one of the foremost authorities on yoga, offers his characteristically pragmatic wisdom for a life of joy and fulfillment. Starting with four basic dimensions of the self –Body, Mind, Emotions, and Energy – Sadhguru introduces us to simple techniques to realign and transform them into a life of sparkling aliveness.

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/LGfdpJNUbzl6UYxtbl7qtfmQ8BTXO4L-3fyyqvEeCtUKhvUx8pmDysTzp2b3uQGZcAkehzVLnfflK5zizch5Upcn4t_KaSlJUM1X20FNQXgEZ2ZO0naBmKePx-0mR_JbRluZzPs9

Inner Engineering is a method of enhancing yourself and emerging into the ideal way you want to be. It is a 7-session online course that provides tools and solutions to empower yourself to create your life the way you want it. It gives you the opportunity to intellectually explore the ABC’s of life using methods from the distilled essence of yogic sciences. The course provides a simple, easy to use, proven methods to empower yourself for self-empowerment.

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru
results.name: Introductory talk

results.description:
The evening session is comprised of: 6:30 - 6:45pm: Tune in, and sign up so we can match you with your pair-programming partner for the evening. 6:45 - 7:15pm: Core JavaScript concept for the challenge and introduction to the secret hack for learning to code - pair-programming. 7:15 - 8:00pm: Pair-programming.

Learn and build with the hard parts of JavaScript through intuitive lectures and pair-programming

In JavaScript the Hard Parts, we cover callbacks, higher-order functions (functional programming with JavaScript), object-oriented programming with JavaScript, closure, scope and execution context

This week we continue our mini-series: Javascript - The Hard Parts. We will cover closure, scope, and execution context - one of the toughest concepts in JavaScript

We'll cover concepts and approaches that 80% of JavaScript engineers do not understand but are at the core of every single successful application. This is possible because we'll understand the essence of these tough concepts and then switch into pair-programming through the challenges to cement the concepts.

The evening session is comprised of: 6:30 - 6:45pm: Meet your future pair programming partner. 6:45 - 6:15pm: Core JavaScript concept for the challenge and introduction to the secret hack for learning to code - pair-programming. 6:15 - 7:00pm: Pair-programming.

Bring a friend who'd like to build and you can pair program together. Price: Always free
results.name: JavaScript the Hard Parts: Closure, Scope & Execution Context @Online

results.description:
Who is that dude you may ask? Why his name is Ignacio Zaragoza and he is one of the main reasons we celebrate Cinco De Mayo. ... Actually we Americans typically celebrate to have yet another festive reason to inebriate and appreciate Mexican food and culture. In Mexico this dude is the hero that repelled the Frenchies from occupying Mexico like the 1%ers they were back then. Culinarily though I am curious to know how that cuisine would have evolved over the years. Mexican food with French influence. Hmmmmm.. My mind stirs.


So armed with this knowledge we will enter the halls of Rosa Mexicano ready to party up like it's 1862. The food at this place is simply fabulous and if you have never been the guac is exceptionally well crafted. Made fresh always table side it is a marvel to behold and taste. Rosa is also known for their fantastic margaritas one such is their pomegranate margarita which is a signature to their restaurant.


I do have to warn you all; Cinco De Mayo in NYC is a hard jam packed party every year. Most Mexican spots that celebrate will be packed to the gills. Service in most spots will not be stellar and it will be mostly standing room.


Know that I am planning this event as a standing room only event for the most part. After 7:30 I will have a small table limited to the first 4 people who arrive and desire to be seated. Otherwise I will be partying up with the rest of you at the bar for the majority of the night. If you are down for this momentous party RSVP now! The food, drinks and atmosphere will be fabulous and it will a great night to remember.

And now... The food porn.
results.how_to_find_us: Come into Rosa and meet me at the Bar ready to party!
results.name: Cinco De Mayo w Rosa Mexicano Ya'll!

results.description:
The focus of this group is on fiction, non-fiction and screenwriting. It is open to all, from beginner to advanced. Meeting nights will revolve between nights of writing together, nights of critique, and/or nights of discussion. Topics of discussion will include writing craft, the business of writing and the writers life. Introductions, individual goals and itinerary for future meetings will be discussed this first evening.

Whether you need a night away from the home front to focus on your writing among other writers, a venue where you can network with others to help navigate the self-publishing world, or someplace you can go to have your writing critiqued as you work your way through the rough spots, this group is designed to be a valuable resource for those looking to leave their DDJ (dreaded day job) to pursue a full time writing career.

Looking forward to seeing everyone there.

results.description:
Please sign up for this class via Eventbrite.

Join us and discover the language that makes the Web interactive: JavaScript.


In this class, we will walk you through the basics of the JavaScript language and how to use it to communicate with the HTML/CSS on a web page. By the end of this class, you will be a able to create an dynamic web page. This class is aimed at beginners with basic knowledge in HTML/CSS. 


Key Takeaways: 


Learn tools you need to get up, running and coding with JavaScript
Learn basic programming concepts like variables, loops, functions, strings, arrays and objects
Learn how to write these things in JavaScript
Interact with the HTML and CSS of a webpage using JavaScript
We’ll provide you with available resources if you’d like to continue learning


Prerequisites and Preparation: 


A basic understanding of HTML/CSS and JavaScript (e.g. topics covered in Codecademy’s HTML & CSS and JavaScript tracks).
Please bring your own laptop (Mac, PC or Chromebook).
Please download and install Sublime Text (Hint: the download button is on the home page).
Light snacks will be provided. 


*This event is open to adult (18+) beginners and is an introduction to concepts covered more deeply in the immersive program.
results.name: Javascript for Beginners

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！
results.name: Chinese and English Language Exchange

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's (We are located 1 room over from the pool tables).  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.

results.description:
This is a FREE yoga class that meets from 6:30 to 8:00 pm, instructed by Chia-Ti Chiu, one of the organizers of this Meetup group.

It is an OPEN LEVEL HATHA FLOW class, appropriate for beginners to advanced students.  There are many variations given to accommodate the different levels of yoga experience.


** You will need to bring your own mat.  There are no yoga mats for rent or use. You can buy yoga mats inexpensively at Marshalls, Filene's Basement, Modells, TJ Maxx, and Target. Many yoga studios also carry a wide range of mats for sale.

IF YOU COME FOR THE FIRST TIME: PLEASE FILL OUT THE REGISTRATION FORM AT THE FRONT DESK. RSVPing on Meetup does not count as Beacon registration.  Your participation and registration helps keep the numbers needed for this program to stay free!


FOR EVERYONE: PLEASE SIGN IN AT THE FRONT DESK CLEARLY AND LEGIBLY

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SPRING with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call 

<a>[masked]</a>

results.description:
SHSNY Book Club: "The Origins of Political Order" - Francis Fukuyama

May 5, 7:00 PM

The Community Church - Gallery

THE ORIGINS OF POLITICAL ORDER: From Prehistoric Times to the French Revolution - Parts 3 (The Rule of Law), 4 (Political Accountability), and 5 (Toward a Theory of Political Development)

Francis Fukuyama

Bestseller Fukuyama provides a sweeping account of how today’s basic political institutions developed, beginning with politics among our primate ancestors and follows the story through the emergence of tribal societies, the growth of the first modern state in China, the beginning of the rule of law in India and the Middle East, and the development of political accountability in Europe up until the eve of the French Revolution.

Drawing on a vast body of knowledge, history, evolutionary biology, archaeology, and economics, Fukuyama has produced a brilliant, provocative work that offers fresh insights on the origins of democratic societies and raises essential questions about the nature of politics and its discontents. from tribes to national governments.

We’ll read and discuss the second half of this blockbuster.. — Paperback

Join us even if you haven’t finished reading. The SHSNY Book Club is open to all … and free!

Greetings Dear Friends,

The Group VortexHealing®  Divine Mother Session is scheduled for Thurs., May 5th, $20, 7pm - 8:45pm, if you're coming in person to Madison Wellness Center, 171 Madison Ave.@ 33rd St., Suite 908, or 7:45pm - 8:45pm EDT if you and / or your pets have registered for the distant list (pets can get on the distant list for free). If you're coming in person please arrive at Madison Wellness by 7pm (THE DOOR WILL BE LOCKED AT 7:30PM) and pay when you arrive in cash or credit / debit card (don't use Paypal if you're coming in person). If you are on the distant list, the energy will run from 7:45pm - 8:45pm EST. There is no conference call or video feed for the distant session, simply lie or sit down in a quiet place where you won't be disturbed from 7:45pm - 8:45pm. PLEASE READ THE REGISTRATION INSTRUCTIONS CAREFULLY (see below). Here's Carol's write up for the session -


In this session Carol and Geordie will be using Merlin's Grace level Vortex Healing® Divine Energy Healing, Geordie's Angelic Liquid Light Healing and a Divine consciousness tool that comes through for Carol. We will be channeling, with the assistance of the archangels, to clear any block or impediments to our harmonious relationship with the Divine Mother. We will also be invoking blessings from the Divine Mother.


It looks like the Divine Mother is gradually unveiling the glories of Spring for us. I hope you have been soaking in the wonders of the sunny days that have been coming our way. Our last session was in honor of Earth Day and our Mother Earth Gaia.  It was a really deep and nurturing session. Thanks to all who participated! We continue to ride the cloak tails of that energy in our next session. The Divine mother shows Herself to us in the wonderful outpouring of the multiplicity of creation. Even though She is the creatrix of life's many forms, she also expresses her love for us as a mother would show love for her own children. The Divine Mother reveals a very personal direct and intimate aspect of the Divine, thus we can enter into a relationship with Her in a communion that is part best friend, part loving mother, part confident and part patient teacher. We see the face of the Divine Mother showing up in various ways in different cultures throughout our history. to name just a few of these She has appeared as;


Durga, Lakshmi the Goddess of abundance, Sarasvati the Goddess of knowledge and the arts, and Shakti the Goddess of Divine energy in the Hindu tradition.


Mother Mary from the Christian tradition


Athena Goddess of wisdom, Demeter mother Goddess, and Aphroditie Goddess of love from the Greek tradition.


Isis, Sekmet and Maat from the Egyptian tradition


Kuan Yin from the Buddhist tradition.

Green Tara from the Tibetan Buddhist tradition.


White Buffalo Calf Woman from the Native North American Tradition


Sedna from the Inuit tradition.


And, of course Gaia, Mother Earth.


So we can see that The Divine Mother has always been with us making her grace available and looking after us with her gifts of abundant life.
Here is a Youtube video that explores the way Divine Mother shows up in many traditions: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5WYf-9xtW-c


Vortex Registration Instructions

In order to register, you must email me at [masked] stating that you are coming in person or that you want to be put on the distant list. If you don't have a PayPal account, click on "Don't have a PayPal account?" on the lower right and fill in the fields with your credit or debit card info. Participants are encouraged to make a written or mental list of their intentions for the session. What do you want to heal, let go of, bring in or enhance in your life (your intentions don't have to be directly related to the theme). We don't have to know what your intentions are, we simply channel with the intent to address whatever you want and need. If you don't have specific goals for the session, just ask for "whatever is best for me".

results.description:
WE NEED TO TALK ABOUT KEVIN - Lionel Shriver

The question of who's to blame for teenage atrocity tortures our narrator, Eva Khatchadourian. Two years ago, her son, Kevin, murdered seven of his fellow high-school students, a cafeteria worker, and a popular algebra teacher. Because he was only fifteen at the time of the killings, he received a lenient sentence and is now in a prison for young offenders in upstate New York. Telling the story of Kevin's upbringing, Eva addresses herself to her estranged husband through a series of letters. Fearing that her own shortcomings may have shaped what her son has become, she confesses to a deep, long-standing ambivalence about both motherhood in general and Kevin in particular. How much is her fault?
results.name: May 2016 - WE NEED TO TALK ABOUT KEVIN
