D&D 5E, "Lost in the Sands": Dungeons & Dragons is a game take on heroic roles and interact with each other and the Dungeon Master to experience fantasy, fights, and epic storytelling. Run by the Strategist’s professional Dungeon Master Ben Williams, this program will offer guidance to beginner players new to the rules of Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition), while still providing a veteran level experience. The campaign will be set in the Dungeon Master’s custom world, Unisum, allowing players a greater degree of character customization and incorporation into the world’s story, while still using 5th edition basic rules and content as a base. Play will consist of a mixture of roleplaying and combat with a focus on long-term story. Character creation, background-building, group play style and other game elements will be covered in the first session. Please contact Ben at [masked] with questions. This campaign will be supported by an Obsidian Portal webpage. Campaign details and background lore can be found at https://lostinthesands.obsidianportal.com/.

Call of Cthulhu 7E, "Masks of Nyarlathotep": Call of Cthulhu is a game of surreal horror in which players strive to uncover a vast and mysterious cosmic conspiracy before losing their lives or their sanity. Run by the Strategist’s professional Keeper of Secret Timm Woods, this program will offer instruction to players new to the rules of Call of Cthulhu (7th Edition), while accommodating advanced play for veteran gamers. Players will begin with the classic introductory Call of Cthulhu scenario “The Haunting” before transitioning into the award-winning “Masks of Nyarlathotep”. Character creation, background-building, and other elements of campaign play will be covered in the first session. Please contact Timm at [masked] with questions.

Remember that signing up for the Meetup event does NOT guarantee you a spot. Follow the link to our registration page and reserve your seat for free immediately!

results.description:
Our David Lerner will provide us information about Ukiyo-e, the delightful and beautiful
Japanese wood block printing art form.

The method was used to produce art prints, ads, religious books, travel books, sex books, and many other types of printed material. In Japan, social and political circumstances
fostered this art form, which was mass produced from the Middle Ages to modern times. When it reached the West, Asian printing technology set off the European Renaissance. For a variety of technical and social reasons, this technology did not have the same impact in Asia.

Today the Internet is the Information
Superhighway. In earlier times, writing and printing caused dramatic social, economic, and political change—as dramatic as the Internet now.

David will show many delightful samples of this art form and put them in historical context.

All are welcome.

results.description:
3D Thursday 5/5 : Z-Unlimited Installation

We're installing a Z-Unlimited at fat cat Fab Lab! Z-Unlimited add-on enables your Ultimaker to print with an unlimited height. Join in on the fun!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nzwaVQaQgmI

---

3D Thursdays!

So... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting!

We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.
results.name: Z-Unlimited Installation

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

We recommend not bringing valuables to the track. You can drop stuff off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team. 


See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

What:
A Social Benefitting Sea Turtle Conservancy

Where:
Pop International Galleries
195 Bowery
New York, NY 10002

When:
Thursday, May 5th, 7:00-9:00PM

Please RSVP by April 25th!

Sea turtles are an indicator species in our oceans. We can tell a lot about the overall health of our oceans by what's happening with sea turtle populations.

Celebrate sea turtles (and Cinco de Mayo!) by joining us at Pop international Galleries in New York City for an event benefitting the Sea Turtle Conservancy. Learn about the different kinds of sea turtles, threats, ongoing projects, and much more!

Admission is FREE but donations are encouraged. There will also be opportunities to support the cause with a raffle and sea turtle adoption and tracking and other prizes.

Not only that, you'll be able to sample tasty food and beverages, including rum drinks made with Naked Turtle Rum, so you definitely will not want to miss it! Space is LIMITED to 100 and RSVPs are on a first-come, first served basis. To RSVP click the link below (or the "Tickets" link above):

http://conserveturtles.org/Secure/artBenefitEvent.php

You can RSVP for up to four people at once.  We look forward to seeing you at Pop!

results.description:
Join us for...
Food as Medicine: NYC Vegetarian Food Festival Edition

{Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/food-as-medicine-veg-fest-tickets-24745745190}

A vegetable-forward conversation with Dr. Thomas Campbell, Rip Esselstyn, Dr. Michelle McMacken, Dr. Robert Ostfeld & Dr. Garth Davis


Co-presented by ABC Home, U.S. Veg Corp, & Thrive Market as part of the Food as Medicine series a conversation series to bring our greatest chefs, farmers, doctors, journalists, activists & wellness experts together to advance the sustainable food movement.

  
Each conversation is recorded live and will be released as a podcast series.

  
Doors open at 6:30pm, conversation starts at 7pm
deepak homebase, on the mezz of abc home 

Panelists

Dr. Thomas Campbell
Thomas M. Campbell II, MD is the co-founder and clinical director of the University of Rochester Program for Nutrition in Medicine, where he works with individuals and groups to prevent and treat illness through diet and lifestyle. A board certified family physician, Dr. Campbell is also medical director of the T. Colin Campbell Center for Nutrition Studies, a leading provider, in partnership with eCornell, of online education in plant-based nutrition. A graduate of Cornell University, Thomas is author of The Campbell Plan and co-author, with his father T. Colin Campbell, PhD, of The China Study, a worldwide bestseller.
Dr. Campbell got his medical degree from the University at Buffalo School of Medicine and completed residency training in Family Medicine at the University of Rochester, Highland Hospital. He has published in the Israel Medical Association Journal and in CME publications Primary Care Reports and Integrative Medicine Alert. He has completed multiple marathons.

Rip Esselstyn
Rip Esselsyn was born in upstate New York, was raised in Cleveland, Ohio, and attended the University of Texas at Austin, where he was a three-time All-American swimmer and majored in speech communications. After graduation Rip spent a decade as one of the premier triathletes in the world. He then joined the Austin Fire Department where he introduced his passion for a whole-foods, plant-based diet to Austin’s Engine 2 Firehouse in order to rescue a firefighting brother’s health. To document his success he wrote the national bestselling book, The Engine 2 Diet, which shows the irrefutable connection between a plant-based diet and good health. His most recent book, Plant-Strong, became a #1 New York Times Bestseller.
Six years ago, Rip left his job as a firefighter to team up with Whole Foods Market as one of their Healthy Eating Partners to raise awareness for team members, customers, and communities about the benefits of eating a whole food, plant-strong diet. He has appeared on numerous national television shows, including the Today show, CBS Morning Show, Good Morning America, and the Dr. Oz show.

Dr. Michelle McMacken
Michelle McMacken, MD, is a board-certified internal medicine physician and Assistant Professor of Medicine at NYU School of Medicine. An honors graduate of Yale University and Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons, she has more than ten years’ experience practicing primary care, directing an obesity clinic, and teaching doctors-in-training at Bellevue Hospital Center in New York City. Dr. McMacken is an enthusiastic supporter of plant-based nutrition and is committed to educating patients and doctors about the power of healthy eating and lifestyle modification. She has been featured on the Rich Roll Podcast, ForksOverKnives.com, Sirius Doctor Radio, and MindBodyGreen.com, among others. She has a Certificate in Plant-Based Nutrition from Cornell University.

Dr. Robert Ostfeld
Robert Ostfeld, MD. MSc, is an Associate Professor of Clinical Medicine at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine. He is the Director of Preventive Cardiology and the founder and director of The Cardiac Wellness Program at Montefiore Medical Center, and the Associate Director of the Cardiology Fellowship at Montefiore-Einstein. Dr. Ostfeld earned his BA from the University of Pennsylvania, graduating Summa Cum Laude and Phi Beta Kappa; his MD from Yale University School of Medicine; and his Masters of Science in Epidemiology from the Harvard School of Public Health. Dr. Ostfeld completed his medical internship and residency at the Massachusetts General Hospital and his cardiology fellowship and research fellowship in Preventive Medicine at Brigham and Women's Hospital - both teaching hospitals of Harvard Medical School. He earned the Outstanding Full Time Attending of the Year award at Montefiore for excellence in teaching medical residents; the Program Director's Award for dedicated service on behalf of the Montefiore-Einstein Cardiology Fellowship; and was elected to the Leo M. Davidoff Society at Einstein for outstanding achievement in the teaching of medical students.

Dr. Garth Davis
Dr. Garth Davis is the medical director of the Davis Clinic at the Methodist Hospital in Houston, Texas, and starred on the hit TLC show Big Medicine.
In addition to his new book Proteinaholic, Dr. Davis is author of The Expert’s Guide to Weight Loss Surgery. Dr. Davis graduated from the UT in Austin where he was the Student Government President. Dr. Davis completed his surgical residency at the prestigious University of Michigan. While there, Dr. Davis underwent extensive training in general surgical disciplines, specializing in laparoscopic procedures.
Dr. Davis has been named a Texas Monthly “Super Doc” several times, most recently in 2015. Dr. Davis is a recognized expert in initial bariatric procedures as well as revisional bariatric surgery, and frequently lectures on the importance of a plant-based diet. He is dedicated to helping people discovern the foods and adopt the behaviors that can lead to a healthy and happy life.
Now that he’s totally recovered Proteinaholic, Dr. Davis competes in marathons and Ironman triathlons. He lives in Houston with his family, a shy cat, and an absurdly large dog.
results.name: Food as Medicine // Lecture Event with Top Vegan Doctors

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
A general Toastmasters club meeting has three parts: a) Project Speeches; b) Table Topics;  and c). Evaluation. 

a).  The first part is Project Speeches. Our Project Speakers get their project assignments from either the Competent Communicationmanual or one of the Advanced Communication manuals. The Project Speakers prepare their speeches according to the project assignment.

b).  The second part of the meeting is Table Topics, which are brief impromptu speeches that require no preparation.  There are two purposes during this part.  The first purpose is to provide a speaking opportunity to members and prospective members who do not have a speaking role. The second purpose is to improve our impromptu speaking skills.

c).  The third and final part of the meeting is the Evaluation portion. Evaluation is an important part of a Toastmasters meeting. Unless we receive feedback on our speeches to know what our strengths and weaknesses are, we will not improve our communication and listening skills.

In the club meeting, you practice giving prepared speeches as well as brief impromptu presentations (Table Topics). There is no rush and no pressure: The Toastmasters program allows you to progress at your own pace.

Constructive evaluation is central to the Toastmasters philosophy. Receiving - and giving - such feedback is a great learning experience. In Toastmasters, encouragement and improvement go hand-in-hand.

Toastmasters is a place where you develop and grow - both personally and professionally. You join a community of learners, and in Toastmasters meetings we learn by doing. Whether you're an executive or a stay-at-home parent, a college student or a retiree, you will improve yourself; building skills to express yourself in a variety of situations. You'll open up a world of new possibilities: giving better work presentations; leading meetings - and participating in them - more confidently; speaking more smoothly off the cuff; even handling one-on-one interactions with family, friends and colleagues more positively.

THIS IS A PAID EVENT - YOU MUST PURCHASE A TICKET ON EVENTBRITE HERE

FuckUp Nights is the fastest growing, global movement of entrepreneurial people who come together to tell, discuss and learn from stories of businesses and personal failure. Now in 150+ cities and 50+ countries worldwide, we’re excited for you to join our fourth FuckUp Nights NYC!

Fuckup Nights NYC Volume 4:

Brad Hargreaves - Original co-Founder of General Assembly, a global educational company in 4 continents on a mission to empower a global community to pursue work they love in data, design, business and technology, and Founder of Common, his latest startup that offers flexible, community-driven housing by providing fully furnished, month-to-month memberships, starting right here in New York City.

Lori Cheek - former Architect for Christian Dior Couture, Founder of dating app Cheek'd and appeared on Shark Tank in 2014.  Come hear her inspiring story and her lessons of failure as she reinvented herself in the wake of her Shark Tank appearance.

Dan Albritton - was part of the 2006 Y Combinator Summer Class in Boston, co-Founder of iminlikewithyou/ OMG POP (Zynga) and co-Founder & CEO of Megaphone TV, which was honored as a TechCrunch Disrupt Hackathon Winner in addition to both an Emmy Award Winner for Outstanding Creative Achievement in Interactive Media - Multiplatform Storytelling as well as an Emmy Nomination for Outstanding Interactive Program.

Speakers will share their story, including the project/business, what they did wrong – the FAIL – and the lessons learned.

Attendees, you’ll enjoy local brews, beverages and snacks in the beautiful Pivotal Labs space in Chelsea with the opportunity to talk with presenters, ask questions, network and share your own fail story in a supportive and collaborative environment.

Need more information?
Follow us on Twitter, Instagram or shoot us an email.

Huge High Fives to our Sponsors

results.description:
Meditation:

To discover deep internal Peace…

To wake up by connecting with your vital Force…

To live with profound Joy and a sense of Well Being…

To experience the Sacred in yourself and those around you.

……

In these times of rapid change and growing fragmentation we feel it’s important to find internal calm and meaning in life. This group offers simple down-to-earth guided meditations designed to connect with deeper parts of oneself and one’s own experience of the sacred.

We use the book “Silo’s Message” to guide our meetings. Silo is a spiritual guide who is also well-known for developing Universalist Humanism.

Our purpose is to create an environment that will nurture and foster deep experiences and help us notice them and live them in our daily life.

Our meetings are small so that everyone can interact easily and comfortably. And they are always open – no commitment or experience is required. Complete beginners are welcome

This is not a religious organization and we welcome and respect people of all backgrounds and beliefs. We work entirely on a volunteer basis. There are no costs for the meeting.

Occasionally we have day long seminars at the Hudson Valley Park of Study and Reflection. This is a beautiful retreat center located 2 hours from New York City which is part of the world-wide network of parks inspired by Silo’s work. http://www.hudsonvalleypark.org/

For information about Silo and his life:

Biography: http://silosmessage.net/about_silo.asp?LANG=EN

Description of Silo’s life work: http://newhumanist.us/?p=1211

The Elks Club is on Route 17 Northbound side, just north of Route 208 and Century Rd. There is a huge American Flag in the front of the property. Visit www.paramus-elks.com or call 201- 262- 5533 for directions.

All proceeds benefit the local Host PWP Chapter. 

I live outside of Philly, so I have not had the opportunity to attend; however, I know DJ Dino and the leadership of the other supporting Meetup groups. I would appreciate an update on your experience. Just post a comment or send me a direct e-mail to [masked] ... 

Your Organizer

Ralph

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Please join us for a special evening event sponsored ZhenFund and hosted by NYCCEO. ZhenFund is an early stage seed fund that invests primarily in startups based in China. You will have the opportunity to meet Anna Fang (方爱之), the CEO & Partner of ZhenFund, over drinks and appetizers. THIS IS AN INVITE-ONLY EVENT. You need to submit a questionnaire by Monday, May 2. We will review your responses and select 15 members for this event. Selected members will receive an email invitation by Wednesday, May 4. 


真格基金合伙人兼CEO, 方爱之, 将与大家相聚纽约, 并和大家分享她从国内带来的创业和投资相关的最新经验和其他干货。你将有机会与她近距离交流，讨论你感兴趣的创业和投资话题。 此次活动会由真格基金赞助和NYCCEO主办。如果您有兴趣参加此次活动，请于5月2号之前填写以下表格。由于活动形式限制，我们将从中选出15位会员， 只有收到邀请才能出席。

Event Time: May 5, 7:30pm - 9:30pm 


Event Location: Manhattan, New York

Application Link: http://dwz.cn/3c4Lf5


Anna Fang is the Partner and CEO of ZhenFund where she oversees ZhenFund’s investments, portfolio management and operations. Since joining ZhenFund in 2011, Anna has managed over 70 seed stage investments in the TMT and education sectors. She also sits on the Board of many of ZhenFund’s investments. Before joining ZhenFund, Anna worked at GE China in Corporate Business Development. She started her career as an investment banker with J.P. Morgan in New York. Anna was named one of the 40 Under 40 Investors by China's Entrepreneur Magazine in 2014. Anna received her undergraduate degree from Columbia University, and a Master of Business Administration from the Stanford Graduate School of Business. ​

方爱之女士是真格基金的合伙人兼CEO，负责真格基金投资组合的管理及基金的整体运营。自2011年加入真格基金以来，方爱之女士已经投资了70多家互联网和教育领域的种子期公司，并担任多家创投公司的董事会成员。在加入真格基金之前，方爱之女士曾任通用电气中国业务发展部经理，负责通用电气中国区的业务发展及兼并收购。她的职业生涯开始于纽约摩根大通。方爱之女士是《创业邦》2014年40位40岁以下投资人之一。 方爱之女士拥有哥伦比亚大学学士学位和斯坦福大学工商管理学硕士学位。

ZhenFund 真格基金： 

真格基金是由新东方联合创始人徐小平、王强和红杉资本中国在2011年联合创立的天使投资基金，旨在鼓励青年人创业、创新、创富、创造。新东方曾经为莘莘学子筑起出国深造的桥梁，真格基金希望能为海外学子搭建起归国创业的彩虹，侧重于但并不限于留学生创业。真格基金乐于帮助那些拥有具备国际意识、懂真格的青年人实现他们的创业梦想。

真格基金专注于TMT行业，包括物联网、移动互联、游戏、企业软件、O2O、电子商务及教育培训等领域的种子期投资。世纪佳缘(Nasdaq: DATE)、兰亭集势(NYSE: LITB)、聚美优品(NYSE: JMEI)、一起作业、找钢网、小红书、蜜芽、美菜网、罗计物流、大姨吗、51talk等多家公司已经成为真格基金投资的明星企业。在“第十四届中国股权投资年度论坛”中，真格荣获2014年中国最佳天使投资机构奖；在“清科集团2015年度中国股权投资年度排名榜单”中获得中国天使投资机构30强第一名。

真格的投资哲学是：真正优秀的人，才能创造伟大的企业。我们致力于发现最优秀的创业者，并为他们提供最好的资源，陪伴他们成功。我们的使命是为创业者插上翅膀。 

NYCCEO - 纽约华人创业家协会： 


NYCCEO于2012年在Meetup社交网站上发起并快速成长为纽约最具影响力的创业服务组织之一，每个月会定期举办各种形式的创业主题活动。自创立以来一直与中美顶尖的创投和科技公司合办活动，活动嘉宾代表机构包括真格基金, 顺为资本, IDG, 线性资本, 小米, Amazon, Google, jet.com, 中国联通, WayUp, 长城会等。

NYCCEO致力建立美国东西岸和中国创业圈的桥梁，宗旨是力求为创业公司寻求优秀人才，为创业项目寻求投资资金，为各种合作寻求对接信息和合作伙伴。我们现有超2,000名来自纽约金融，IT，科技，时尚，设计等各领域的优秀人才。

results.description:
Come AWOL with us! (After Work Origami Lovers) 

After a long week what could be better than meeting with friends and potential new friends to fold your work week away! Come fold with us at AWOL!

Its a lot of fun and more intimate than our once a month big meetings. A great place to learn some new models and also get help on models you're been stuck on. Bring your latest folds and creations for show and tell and your favorite models to teach and learn.

This meeting is free and open to all level of folders from beginners to advanced. bring paper and your books and also there will always be free paper available to share so you can just show up and fold! 

Please try to RSVP so others will know you will be there.

Hope to see you there! happy folding!!

Due to the closing of Cosi at 23rd around 9pm. At this time this group will be meeting at Panera Breads near 28th and 29th, with a backup location meeting of Argo Tea near FIT. Panera closes at 10pm, and Argo closes at 11pm. 

Also I usually get there a bit earlier, so please look for paper folders, or at least the presence of paper. 

-Linda

NOTE: Please try to RSVP if possible so others will know you will be there. Thanks.

results.description:
Kerry Rasp, a well respected meditation and MBSR teacher of the Dharma community, will gently guide you away from the stress of the day to experience the calmness of being in the present moment.

You deserve to give yourself this time off from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

You will feel how settling into the present through insight meditation may ease your tension, anxiety, frustration, and more.

Our sangha is open to all...whether you are new to meditation or experienced in sitting.

If you wish, please bring your mat or cushion. We will replace a chair with your mat or cushion, if you want. Some prefer chairs while others are more comfortable on mats or cushions.

Q & A will follow meditation. Please bring your questions and comments about meditation and your practice. Kerry's vast knowledge will provide you with accurate information in a clear manner.

Also, please email me any questions you want answered before our meeting.

***More persons usually join us for meditation than is indicated on Meetup RSVPS from Insight Timer and word of mouth.

Wishing you well!

results.description:
In this mixed class we get together and explore inner peace, and self empowerment. Let's get grounded: lets get high. 

We will use the faculties of our BBB's, Bodies, Brains & BREATH through the art of Yoga, QiGong, Pranayama (Power Energy Breathing) and guided Meditation. Come breath into balance, grove into motion, and relax into stillness; with good music and positive energy, in a relaxed and intimate atmosphere (6 people). Come experience this unique integration and how it can light you up, and have you feeling both peaceful and EMPOWERED! 

Come with a yoga mat 

A clear intention 

And an open heart

This Meetup is held on an ongoing basis, Thursday evenings with an energy exchange of $20

important Note:***Please do not use strong, unnatural perfumes or soaps as some participants are allergic! Thank You! ****

I look forward to serving and empowering you to live a happier, more peaceful and effective life, as we form our mindful community.

Om Namaha Shivaya 

Peace,

Serena

results.description:
Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leaders - Joanne & LD)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 7:45pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 8:00pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture
All proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If PS2G cancels a game, please go to this link ps2g.org/games/refund-request for a refund.

There is a minimum of 4v4 with 8 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

[masked]

results.description:
Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

Rejection is so stupid. It leads to shame, self-doubt, and Ugly Cry Face. But what if we took one night celebrate our rejections and air our failures? We will leave feeling lighter, happier, hotter? Join us on May 5 to find out. 

Performances from:
Tim Manley (GIRLS, The Moth Radio Hour)   
Mary Mack (Last Comic Standing)
North Coast (NYC's hip hop improv comedy team)
Tim Harmston (David Letterman)
Chris Calogero (Fusion TV)
hosted by Emily Winter and Carolyn Busa 

Tickets are $5 online/$8 door and can be purchased here! 

Join us in this special celebration of rejection!
results.name: Rejectified: A One-Night-Only Comedy Show About Rejection!

results.description:
Time Chasers! It's the story of a man named Nick who turns his airplane into a time machine with the aid of his beloved Commodore 64.

With it he woos the woman of his dreams, despite the fact that he doesn’t own a car and his wardrobe consists only of a pair of jeans and a threadbare t-shirt from Castleton State College.

For those of you who’ve only seen the MST3K episode, this live show will feature the full, uncut 89-minute movie, so… there’s that.

Get your tickets now!

Buy tickets to the May 5th live event!
results.name: Time Chasers: riffed Live!

results.description: World premiere play about Edward R Murrow, arguably the greatest journalist of all time. From Murrow's beginnings at CBS, to the London Blitz, liberation of Buchenwald, and on air confrontation with Joe McCarthy -- more than a biographical look at an American icon, Murrow is an indictment of the commercialization of media. Following the performance on Thursday, May 5 there will be a post-show conversation with Eric Alterman of The Nation and Robert Anderson and Catherine Olian Producers of "60 Minutes" on the impact and influence of corporate $$ on media and the news. Tickets with code "MEETUP" are $25 (no fees) for show and post show conversation. Order: https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe.c/10025820 -- use code on check out or call the box office at[masked]

results.description:
We all know the term "Law of Attraction." But, what is it, really? How does it work? And, what practical place does it have in day-to-day life?

The purpose of this group is to answer these questions, as well as bring like-minded people together to form a network of support in living with clear intention. You'll learn about the Universal Laws and Abraham Hicks' processes and practices. This will help you shift your energetic vibration, align with your higher self and empower you to deliberately create a life you love.

Coming together as a group to do this type of work is incredibly powerful. This is truly our life's work, and committing to our lives in this way is not only transformational for us. It's transformational for those around us.

$20

Please register at: https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/ws?studioid=231300&stype=41&sTG=53&prodId=10271

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

“For the eyes of the Lord run to and fro throughout the whole earth, to shew himself strong in the behalf of them whose heart is perfect toward him. Herein thou hast done foolishly: therefore from henceforth thou shalt have wars.” (2 Chronicles 16:9 KJV)

ATTENTION ALL MEMBERS OF THE CHRISTIAN PARTY OF AMERICA.

All members of the national organization of the Christian Party of America are invited to attend the monthly “Members Only” Conference Call via Skype.  If you are already a member of the national organization, you can obtain the call-in information by emailing the National Chairman Clell Drumheller at [masked].  If you are not yet a member but would like to become a member, you can find out how to join and obtain the membership forms at http://christianpartyonline.com/wp/join-the-party/

So members Please join us at the Christian Party of America’s monthly Members Only Conference Call to discuss current political issues with like-minded Christians. The conference call is the first Thursday of each month at 8:30 PM est. (7:30 PM central). Clell Drumheller, National Chairman of the Christian Party of America and Texas State Chairman will lead the discussion on what can be done to address the concerns we all share for the status of our country’s civil government. Every quarter the National Executive Committee will hold its business meeting during the call and members are invited to observe the Executive Committee meeting on those occasions.

The Christian Party of America’s nationwide members only Conference Calls are a great opportunity to connect with other members of the Christian Party as we try to make a difference in this country. So sign on with us for the conference call to discuss issues and contribute your thoughts about what we can be doing politically. It is an easy-access way to share ideas and learn more about what is going on around the country with the Christian Party of America. Hope you can make it!

There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges by your phone plan for a long distance call.

“11 Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.12 For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.13 Wherefore take unto you the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day, and having done all, to stand.” (Ephesians 6:11-13 KJV)
results.name: MEMBERS ONLY CHRISTIAN PARTY OF AMERICA CONFERENCE CALL

results.description:
Join us for our twice-monthly meditation group! We've found that it's nice to have an environment where everyone can relate and feel comfortable because we've all had similar experiences of anxiety.

We meditate together, discuss ways to apply meditation principles to work more skillfully with our anxiety, and support each other by listening and sharing our experiences (only if you want to!).

We are going to livestream the group for people who live out of town. You can join the livestream here</a> or, if you don't have a Google account, <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aaXPzKK-rI8">try here!
results.name: Meditation Group for People with Anxiety

group.name: Breathing Room: meditation group for folks with anxiety

results.description:
Nervousness, worries and self-doubts are all part of a FEAR MATRIX. Are you working to change your FEAR MATRIX for speaking and presentations or are you hoping it will somehow solve itself? 

It's that time of the year again. Time to spring clean your brain of fears! it's possible to have fun playing with fears instead of fear playing with you. You can get a NEW FRESH START on your life. You have tried everything else through videos and books. Time to get fully involved in 3 dimensions your like when you practice yoga. Go pass your fears to fearless live. Life is full of endless possibilities when you practice your fears away. Most people don't understand what is actually possible for themselves because of "FEAR BLOCKS." Like bricks in a wall, your fears and worries can separate you from your capabilities and powers. You can removing "Fear Bricks" one-by-one until you are clean of excess fear. Uncluttered your mind of excess fears that stop you from pursuing your goals. Too much of your day is cluttered with fears and worries. Make much needed brain space by clearing out your fears to make room for your big DREAMS.


$15.00 Door Fee


CLICK HERE NOW TO RSVP FOR $10.00
results.name: LIVE STUDIO SESSION: GO PASS YOUR FEARS TO FEARLESS

results.description:
Play Pick Up soccer with us late night for just $10ea, saving you 33% on the normal price. Spaces are limited so RSVP soon and tell your mates.

**Pay cash at reception**

If your new to the group what better excuse to try us out. We play 3v3 or 4v4 depending on numbers. (No keepers)

THE PITCH is NYC’s only soccer-specific indoor facility, located in the heart of Brooklyn’s Williamsburg neighborhood at North 14th and Berry St.

We have one field, which is slightly longer and wider than the standard NYC Parks basketball court and middle-school gym. Unlike most of these courts/gyms, our field has a walled (padded) perimeter, so the ball never goes out. Also, our flooring is a real field: the best professional-grade turf product on the market -- the same turf used by many professional teams in the Netherlands and recently by some MLS teams like Sporting Kansas.

results.description:
Speaker Bio: David Benge is a Lead Computer Scientist at Adobe Systems. As a member of the Adobe @ Adobe team he focuses on building innovative solutions using Adobe’s own products and helping to improve our products by being customer one. He has been working in the industry for over 20 years. Most of his professional career has been spent focusing on web based solutions. Before working at Adobe David managed his own company building mobile focused solutions for Verizon, AT&T, Microsoft, Sundance, and others. He has also worked for Packard Bell NEC and AT&T starting way back in the early 90’s. 

Topic: AEM and Adobe Analytics: Integration by Example 

In this talk David will walk you through an example of how to integrate Adobe Analytics with AEM. You will learn how Adobe integrated communities.adobe.com with Adobe Analytics and extended it with with custom events, and a thrid party plugin. 

This event will be broadcasted LIVE from Seattle AEM Community starting 7:00pm. 

You may want to join these AEM communities to stay updated on monthly Meetups in below cities: 


1. New York


2. San Francisco

3. Chicago

4. Seattle

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."

results.description:
Come join us May 6th to hear New York City-based designer + hacker, Ben Fisher. He can write, design and produce a mobile app telling you where to find a full pot of coffee in your office building, faster than you can make a new pot of coffee—amongst many other ingenious talents.

Ben is CTO + Head of Product at CartHook, software that helps ecommerce stores recover abandoned shopping carts. 


Before CartHook, Ben co-founded Lean Startup Machine and Alchemy (acquired in 2013).  He has more than a decade of experience working with award-winning companies including Volkswagen, Burger King, Disney, and IDEO. 

His entrepreneurial work has been featured in Forbes, Esquire, Gizmodo, Mashable, Harvard's Nieman Lab, on ABC World News, and others.

We're thrilled to have Ben speak at our upcoming MeetUp, as he has served on many panels, including at SXSW. Get ready to learn lots, and leave with all wheels in gear.
results.name: Inside the brain of Ben Fisher, serial entrepreneur/human startup machine

Time to try something new!  Stop working at home alone, or in a Panera.  Get out and find a place where you can do your work on your own, but be around like minded people!  This is where communities are made for entrepreneurs! If you are a writer, consultant, designer, or programmer -- This is ideal for you!

This is not a typical meetup. This meetup is to offer you a FREE morning to work out of The CoWorking Space and understand what coworking is all about.

We have coffee, water, snacks, free parking in the back lot (unlimited hours) and on Main Street (for only 3 hours).

We have great food right around the corner, banks, ATMs, convenience stores and more all within your reach. So get out of your house, stop working alone and come by for a FREE day!

Besides bringing your laptop, bring business cards as you will meet others to network with in between work.

See you on our next Fun Friday!

results.description:
We handpicked and will showcase some of the best NYC resources for minority and women owned businesses.  You will have the chance to hear from a panel of experts about how they help women and minority business grow by accessing capital, networks, education, mentors and more. 

Your NYC Network of Resources: 

Valley Economic Development Center 

The VEDC provides financing for high-growth businesses in the New York Tri-State area, offering small business loans to start-up and existing businesses operating in low to moderate income communities.  VEDC and JPMorgan Chase & Co. recently announced a new lending program for African American-owned small businesses in New York City. The National African American Small Business Loan Fund will boost economic opportunity for minority-owned businesses in NYC  by providing greater access to capital, technical assistance and financial consulting. 

Women Entrepreneurs NYC 

Women entrepreneurs are key economic actors in New York City – building businesses that support families, uplift communities and generate jobs. WE NYC is a first-of-its-kind effort in a major American city to address the entrepreneurship gender gap and empower women business-owners to reach their full economic potential. We NYC will connect women entrepreneurs with the resources, education, and connections they need to thrive.


Project Enterprise 

PE provides business training and financing to entrepreneurs regardless of prior business experience or current business status, credit status and whether they have guarantors or collateral. PE is partnering with KIva Zip to launch a new training program to help entrepreneurs access interest free loans. 

Entrepreneurs' Organization ("EO")

The Entrepreneurs' Organization ("EO") is a global membership organization whose members are the owners of businesses that generate a minimum of $1 million in revenue.  We have over 11,000 members in over 40 countries.  Many entrepreneurs experience loneliness and isolation in running their business.  With an average of 2 events a month, EO provides a place for entrepreneurs to congregate on a regular basis.  EO also provides monthly forum groups from small more intimate connectivity amongst EO members. EO members are also connected virtually through a dedicated EO Google group. 

About EO 2030

EO 2030 is an initiative of the EO NY chapter.  At EO 2030 we look to create a richer and more diverse human experience for EO members.  We look to accomplish this by first, connecting with a variety of business membership organizations and entrepreneurs from different cultures and demographics and, second, through the ongoing exchange of intellectual capital between EO and these organizations and entrepreneurs.  We feel that this cultural exchange will lead to partnerships, joint ventures and other business opportunities between our EO members and the members of these communities, and will allow both communities to be on the cutting edge of new business and demographic trends 

(More NYC Resources Coming soon)
results.name: Building Your NYC Network of Resources: For Women and Minority Businesses

results.description:
Hello Fam!
This week we have the pleasure of having Steven Greenberg of ffVC come and share his journey.

Steven is an analyst at ff Venture Capital, an early stage fund based in New York. Prior to joining ffVC, Steven served as a Project Assistant to the CEO of Aol, Tim Armstrong. Steven was a Co-founder of Unroll.me (acquired by Rakuten), an email subscription management tool which has helped its 2 million users block over 5 billion unwanted newsletters. 


He additionally held roles as a Product Developer at the Huffington Post and as a Digital Strategist at MKTG.


We'll get a chance to hear about his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! 

Also join us for good coffee and excellent conversation. 
Until then, stay cool and classy... 

See you this Friday!


Future events:

Are you working on a startup and ready to raise funding?  Brian, a partner from KEC Ventures, would like to talk to early stage technology startups that are ready for seed and Series A round.  Please introduce your startup and your team by filling out this form. (This form is only viewed by the organizers and Brian from KEC Ventures).  Top 6 projects will be selected for one-on-one meeting with Brian on May 6.  Exact time slot will be announced closer to the date.

Submission deadline:  May 3, 2016.

About KEC Ventures:


KEC Ventures is a Seed and Series A venture fund based in New York City that invests mainly in early stage technology startups capable of transforming the markets in which they operate. It partners with talented entrepreneurs and works with them, offering strategic advice and support, as they build their startups.

About Brian:


Brian Laung Aoaeh devotes most of his time to seeking founders who are building technology startups in which KEC Ventures should consider investing. He blogs at www.innovationfootprints.com. You can also find him on: Twitter: @brianlaungaoaeh, LinkedIn: Brian Laung Aoaeh and Instagram: @brianlaungaoaeh. 

What Brian is looking for?

http://innovationfootprints.com/user-manual-the-early-stage-startups-i-want-to-hear-about-most-in-2016-and-2017/

results.description:
BKLYN DESIGNS is Brooklyn’s premier design event showcasing a cross section of design, architecture, and art. Founded by the Brooklyn Chamber of Commerce in 2003, it was one of the first design fairs to shine a spotlight on the creative economy in Brooklyn, and serves as an incubator for emerging designers as well as a platform for established brands producing a range of creative products across furniture, lighting, tableware, art, textiles, and jewelry.

Demonstrating the collaborative spirit of design, the show will feature inspiring collective exhibits, pop-up lounges, installations, hands-on demos and a diverse conference program in addition to an exciting array of products. It will also include rotating food trucks and libations from Brooklyn’s beloved vendors as well as family-friendly programming throughout the weekend.

http://www.bklyndesigns.com

ATTENTION, LADIES!
WE'RE BACK AT IT AGAIN...

After the success of our inaugural Women's History Month event, we're back for another fun, interactive and inspiring event. In honor of Mother's Day, we're putting the focus on working moms who juggle it all!

As always, we'll kick off the afternoon with cupcakes and cosmos to help get the conversation flowing and continue with inspirational stories of tribulations and triumphs from our impressive panel of mompreneurs and visionaries.

But the fun doesn't end there, we've also got a series of short, info-packed marketing breakout sessions designed to give you the knowledge and ammunition to make an immediate impact in your professional life.

results.description:
Next Friday afternoon one of our very own filthy GRINDHOUSE members, Robert Brenner, will be leading a FREE walking tour of "Dirty Old Times Square" as part of the Jane Jacobs centenary celebration.

http://janeswalk.org/united-states/new-york-city-ny/dirty-old-times-square


About This Walk:

Back in the 1970s, Times Square was a dangerous, exciting, gritty, authentic, diverse neighborhood. Love it or hate it, you couldn’t ignore it. Most of old Times Square has been carefully obliterated by generic hotels and office buildings, but there are still vestiges of its seedy past—if you know where to look. Some questions:

Is Times Square better off now or was it better back then?

How do you balance the desire for safety with the need for freedom?

Can you have a major city without a red light district?

Can you “clean up” a neighborhood without destroying it?

Does Times Square belong to tourists or locals or both?

What role did racism and homophobia play in cleanup efforts?


About the Jane Jacobs at 100 Celebration:

"Cities have the capability of providing something for everybody,
only because, and only when, they are created by everybody."

-Jane Jacobs

The Municipal Art Society of New York (MAS) is a leading independent advocacy organization that inspires, educates, and empowers New Yorkers to engage in the betterment of their city. This year, MAS welcomes you to join Celebrating the City: Jane Jacobs at 100, a celebration dedicated to legendary urban activist Jane Jacobs on the 100th anniversary of her birth.

Jane Jacobs believed in empowering urban citizens to get involved in their communities and shape their city. [A great synopsis, called Jane Jacobs: Ten Big Ideas by Nate Storing, formerly of the Jane’s Walk Project Office and now at Project for Public Spaces, is here.] The celebration, spanning May through October 2016, will honor her impact by bringing together hundreds of self-organized events and activities under a single banner that reveal the dynamic energy, innovation and creativity of cities.

Encompassing everything from installations and walking tours to workshops and public performances, this website will serve as an aggregate of all the unique ways that people are paying tribute to Jacobs’ legacy. We invite you to join the celebration by submitting an event of your own or attending one in your city!

www.jj100.org

https://youtu.be/pcU9ptlRIGw
results.name: FREE walking tour of "Dirty Old Times Square"!

results.description:
Join us for a demo day of our students' final project, Mapper NYC, which provides neighborhood recommendations for the modern New Yorker.  This will be followed by a graduation celebration. Check out the website for Mapper NYC in advance and have your questions ready.

http://narwhals.byteprojects.co

 Hear it from our students, on the usage of data for Mapper NYC: 

" Before we were able to collect all of our data, we first had to know what data was available, accessible and scalable. This led us to census data, data collected at the state and city level, as well as various API's including Google Maps, Yelp, and Streeteasy. One key requirement, was to reference any data we collected to a particular NYC neighborhood. That meant storing data categorized at the neighborhood level. However, more often than not, data available was by geographical coordinates or zip code, leading us to create a mapping to the appropriate neighborhood. 

Having all our data reference a particular neighborhood simplified the database and algorithm design processes. We stored our data in a star schema design with our neighborhoods at the center.  This enabled quick quering as well as the ability to add, remove, and update our data seamlessly. Our algorithm uses this data to identify neighborhoods whose characteristics most closely match what a user inputs inputs in our form, finding the best suited neighborhoods across NY. The algorithm weighs more heavily what is important to users, to ensure suitable responses. 

Lastly, we were able to add other features like map and street view, learn more and the ability to graph all results from a query to find trends. Along with Facebook login, these features help create a conprehensive and user friendly site for anyone to use."

                                                                                --- Jack, part of the Mapper NYC Team
results.name: Demo Day and Graduation - Mapper NYC

results.description:
We'll be seeing - - - 

Munch and Expressionism 

         Above: The Scream (1895) by Edvard Munch (1863 -                      1944). Pastel on board in the original frame.

"Munch and Expressionism" is an exhibition that examines Edvard Munch’s influence on his German and Austrian contemporaries, as well as their influence upon him. The show offers a compelling new look at works by the Norwegian artist, whose painting The Scream has become a symbol of modern angst. The Neue Galerie is the sole venue for the exhibition. This exhibition has been organized in partnership with The Munch Museum, Oslo. 

Edvard Munch [masked]) was highly regarded for his exploration of dark themes, including alienation, sin, and human vulnerability. Munch’s use of vivid color intensifies the emotional power of his subject matter, an approach which helped to pave the way for an entirely new attitude towards art during the early twentieth century. Although much has been written about the relationship between Munch’s personal life and his art, this exhibition is the first thorough study of the artist’s work in the context of his German and Austrian peers.

The exhibition consists of approximately 35 paintings and 50 works on paper from both public and private collections worldwide. The German artists included in the exhibition are Max Beckmann, Erich Heckel, Ernst Ludwig Kirchner, Gabriele Münter, and Emile Nolde, and the Austrians included are Richard Gerstl, Oskar Kokoschka, and Egon Schiele. The exhibition compares all of these artists’ approaches to key themes such as adolescence, urban anxiety, and self-portraiture, and to innovative developments in printmaking during this time. The exhibition will include several works that have never before been seen in the United States.

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked].

The Marty Lyons Foundation is an organization that help grants wishes to Terminally Ill kids ages 4-16.  They have a wish from a child, Christopher Quinonez-Lopez age 12 from Florida whose wish is to come to NYC and visit some of our landmarks in June.  Christopher has been diagnosed with Acute Lympholastic Leukemia a form of childhood cancer.  Please join us  at The St. Patrick's Irish Pub on 46th for a special Happy Hour where we will come together to help fund the cost of Christopher's wish!  Admission is free but if you wish to make a donation or participate in the raffles that would be appreciated! Here is how it works:

-We will have the entire 2nd and 3rd floor reserved for our groups beginning at 6pm.

-Our staff will be on hang to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

-We will have 2 ice breaker games between 7:30 and 9pm

-There will be drink specials all night

-We will have raffle and prizes including show tickets, restaurant certificates and other fun things

-Music played at conversational levels

-If you wish to participate in the Trivia Night or Grand Central Murder Mystery you can as they both start and end at St Pat's.

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.

Dress code:  business casual

We need to raise about $500 to cover the cost.  His wish is to visit The Empire State Building, The Central Park Zoo, The World Trade Center Observation Deck and to take a Double Decker Bus Tour with his family.  We hope to also include their meals.

If you can not make the happy hour and wish to donate please call the foundation at[masked] and tell them that you would like to make a donation toward Christopher's wish trip.
results.name: Happy Hour To Grant A NYC Wish For A Sick Child - Free Event

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked].

The Marty Lyons Foundation is an organization that help grants wishes to Terminally Ill kids ages 4-16.  They have a wish from a child, Christopher Quinonez-Lopez age 12 from Florida whose wish is to come to NYC and visit some of our landmarks in June.  Christopher has been diagnosed with Acute Lympholastic Leukemia a form of childhood cancer.  Please join us  at The St. Patrick's Irish Pub on 46th for a special Happy Hour where we will come together to help fund the cost of Christopher's wish!  Admission is free but if you wish to make a donation or participate in the raffles that would be appreciated! Here is how it works:

-We will have the entire 2nd and 3rd floor reserved for our groups beginning at 6pm.

-Our staff will be on hang to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

-We will have 2 ice breaker games between 7:30 and 9pm

-There will be drink specials all night

-We will have raffle and prizes including show tickets, restaurant certificates and other fun things

-Music played at conversational levels

-If you wish to participate in the Trivia Night or Grand Central Murder Mystery you can as they both start and end at St Pat's.

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.

Dress code:  business casual

We need to raise about $500 to cover the cost.  His wish is to visit The Empire State Building, The Central Park Zoo, The World Trade Center Observation Deck and to take a Double Decker Bus Tour with his family.  We hope to also include their meals.

If you can not make the happy hour and wish to donate please call the foundation at[masked] and tell them that you would like to make a donation toward Christopher's wish trip.
results.name: Happy Hour To Grant A NYC Wish For A Sick Child - Free Event

results.description:
Hello Quickers,

If you're interested in getting on a stage in a low pressure environment to try some improv, this event is for you. We will likely to do some warmups, 2-person scenes, and then do some short sets with other more veteran improvisers. Participate as much or as little as you would like. Or simply come and watch! 

All who attend will get to do 2-person scenes and a bigger jam set at the end!  This is the most low pressure fun performance opportunity out there - perfect for all!  If you're think you're ready, you're ready!  All scenes will be inspired by a suggestion of a random word from the audience.

Thanks
results.how_to_find_us: Call or text 2039082664
results.name: Come and Perform Improv on stage for Free!

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan are among the oldest) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

The card keys for the bathrooms are available from the front desk.  As a courtesy, please check to see if anyone else in the group needs to use the keys before returning them to the front desk.
results.name: Friday evening gaming at Flushing

results.description: Hey gang. Let's try a Friday evening of games at Whole Foods in downtown Manhattan. I should be there around 6 pm. The place is open till 11 pm. We'll be upstairs and I'll be wearing a Meetup button. Don't be shy. RSVP and join us. I'll announce the games later.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for tables upstairs with games on them.

results.description:
We're thrilled to invite you to out next GUY SPOTLIGHT, where we feature shows, performances, art, and talent from within our very own members of Guy Social! Next up: VERNON PAYNE

Vernon is an INCREDIBLY talented illustrator and painter, and he's invited us all to the opening of his new show in Brooklyn, titled NEON BROOKLYN. Here's his description:

“Neon Brooklyn” is my first attempt at creating surrealist large-scale paintings from the inspiration of living in Brooklyn. Each painting is combined with video telling a story of the people who dwell in and around the beautiful borough of Brooklyn. I first thought of creating these surrealist paintings around 2006 in under-grad at Columbia College Chicago. As a result of many hours drawing and producing videos, I have now mastered the aesthetic and quality needed to prove that I am a master skilled in the modern-day art world.

Join me on May 6th, 2016, at Gratitude Cafe to experience these extraordinarily rare quality hand-made paintings.


GRATITUDE CAFE
499 ROGERS AVE.
BROOKLYN, NY 11225

OPENING RECEPTION
FRIDAY, MAY 6TH,[masked]PM

ON VIEW
MAY 6TH - JUNE 20TH, 2016
results.name: GUY SPOTLIGHT: VERNON PAYNE'S opening of his art show "NEON BROOKLYN"

results.description:
Join us for a special, two-hour networking and workshop event for minority business owners during National Small Business Week at the Microsoft Store.

This free event will include:

A keynote presentation and Q&A by Adnan Rafique, Microsoft Collaboration Architect A workshop that will take your business to the next level with Office 365 An opportunity to network with other local business owners A look at the many free resources and services available to business customers As a thank you for attending the event, you will receive a coupon for a 10% discount on Surface devices*. Bring a friend, enjoy great savings, and learn how you can enhance your business with services and solutions from Microsoft.

Register today as space is limited.

*Offer valid from May 1, 2016 to May 7, 2016. Offer is available while supplies last. Available in Microsoft retail and online store in the United States (including Puerto Rico) only. Only valid for Customers who attend SMB Week event and present flyer. Limits and exclusions apply.  Not valid on prior orders or purchases; cannot be transferred or otherwise redeemed for cash or coupon code(s).  Combinable with Essentials bundles, not combinable with Student or Military; may not combinable with other offers. Non-stackable with any other offers.  Refunds will take into account the discount. Price discount does not include taxes, shipping or other fees. Void where prohibited or restricted by law. Microsoft reserves the right to modify or discontinue offers at any time. Limit of 1 offer per customer. See store associate for details.
results.how_to_find_us: www.microsoftstore.com/willowbrook

results.description:
For our Spring/Summer sessions, we shall revert back to 3 Teams.

• Teams will be 7 a-side, 6 outfield players, NO sub, and a goal keeper.

• We play for 8 minutes or 2 goals.

• Winner stays! 

• If the initial game between the first 2 teams ends in a tie, a coin toss will be used to determine which team stays on.

• In the event of a tie, the new or incoming team stays on.

• Be Social, use your time on the sideline to get to know your teammates better :))


• We now play with 3 different practice jerseys. RED uptown logo bibs, LIME GREEN, and BLUE bibs.  

• We will provide clean freshly laundered bibs for every game. However, to encourage a sense of community and keep cost low, we encourage members to take the bibs they've worn for the game home, wash and please return back to us. 


Please signup ASAP and may the force be with you :)

Disclaimer: By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
The Amateur Astronomers Association is proud to present an astronomy lecture series from October through May each year for our members and the public. Everyone is welcome to attend. Admission to the lecture is free, and no reservations or tickets are required.

The lectures are held at the Kaufmann Theater of the American Museum of Natural History, on Central Park West between 77th and 81st streets. Please use the 77th Street entrance. Lectures begin at 6:15 p.m. and run to 8:00 p.m. 

More information at:

http://www.aaa.org/lectures/

Friday, May 6, 2016


Primavada Natarayan 
Yale University

“Unravelling the Nature of Dark Matter”
results.name: Amateur Astronomers Association of NY Lecture Series at AMNH
