venue.name: Art of Living New York Center

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!
results.how_to_find_us: http://imeditateny.org
results.name: Breath To Happiness

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

group.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
活动收取门票$5每人。到场并参与游戏的请准备$5现金，刷卡$6。请在入场时交付并登记姓名 （定期有特殊优惠)。只观战不参与游戏的，不需要交费。晚到或提前退场但参与游戏的，门票价钱一样$5。

---------------------------------------------------------

如果你玩过杀人游戏或狼人杀，却还没听过阿瓦隆，那我不得不说您有点out啦！

与狼人杀相似，阿瓦隆也是一款角色扮演加逻辑推理游戏，玩家扮演不同身份，在辩驳之中分辨好人坏人。与狼人杀不同的是，玩家人数为5 - 10人，每一位玩家都能够参与到游戏最后，不存在被杀被票死就只能干看别人玩的情景。

这个游戏考验玩家的逻辑分析能力以及彼此的信任度，是一款绝对不会让你失望的游戏！如果您没有玩过这款游戏也不用担心，游戏规则很简单5分钟就可以学会，即便您对此游戏一无所知来参加我们活动也没关系。

玩家人数达到5人即举办活动，游戏时间5月6日6:30pm - 9:30pm。如果人数多，会开2-3桌或组织升级等其他游戏。地点在距离Penn Station步行五分钟的XYZ IMPRESSION Studio。地址：470 7th Ave, Suite 410, New York, NY 10018. 由于游戏受玩家人数影响，请大家尽量早到5 - 10分钟，不要迟到，6:30pm准时开始介绍游戏规则。

报名请RSVP并将姓名，Email，电话私信(message)给Lisa Yu.
results.name: 桌游Avalon阿瓦隆／升级／Jenga

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath. 

This 60 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program.

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.

No fees for Newbies

Repeater fee-$10(Cash only)

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

Hi Everyone

I just learned that Kombucha expert, Hannah Crum, of Kombucha Kamp, will be visiting NYC to give a workshop and do a book signing at Brooklyn Brainery!  She's on tour for her new book, The Big Book of Kombucha.   From what I have heard, tickets are going fast, so get register now if you are interested. For only $5, it's a steal!

You MUST register through Brooklyn Brainery.  An RSVP here DOES NOT reserve your spot!  Please register here

Best,
Angela Davis
NYC Ferments

Kombucha 101


The fermented food revolution is here, and Kombucha is leading the way! This fermented, probiotic-rich tea drink has become a staple at health food stores and markets across the country. Yet most Kombucha devotees probably don’t realize how easy and inexpensive this drink is to brew at home.

If you can brew a cup of tea, you can brew Kombucha! As bacteriosapiens, we are bacteria powered. The more bacteria-rich fermented foods that we incorporate into our diet, the better we feel. Learn how easy it is to enjoy the benefits of brewing Kombucha at home for a fraction of the cost while nourishing your human microbiome in this Kombucha 101 talk & Q/A with the world’s foremost Kombucha expert, Hannah Crum aka the Kombucha Mamma.

The Big Book of Kombucha shows readers how to brew their own Kombucha from start to finish, with illustrated step-by-step instructions and recipes for 286 different flavor combinations. With endorsements from Andrew Zimmern, award-winning TV chef and Michelle Tam, best-selling author of Nom Nom Paleo, this treasury of Kombucha knowledge is the definitive resource for guidance on making and customizing the drink at home.  

Copies of the book will be available for purchase at the talk.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Let's watch and discuss a great recent film about one of the most important social justice movements!  The reviews on this film say it has great characters and compelling to watch, but misses the complexity of the actual historical movement.  I think it will be a great intro and discussion-starter.  

A review of Suffragette:

"It's an unforgivable shame that such an important event in world history as the women’s suffrage campaign has received so little attention from TV and Hollywood. So little in fact, that there’s never been a feature film based on this true life event that literally changed history by eventually leading to voting rights for women.

But these women of the suffrage movement who were willing to sacrifice everything they had for their right to vote, finally get a feature film in Sarah Gavron’s soul-stirring Suffragette, a film that doubles as both an unforgettable history lesson and a darn good piece of entertainment. Though it narrows its focus down to the singular perspective of just a few of the movement’s key participants during a thin slice of the 50+ year battle for women’s voting rights, and because the subject matter carries such relevance in today’s world, Suffragette is a film that matters. And one that must be seen.

Bookended by grainy newsreel footage of actual pre-World War I marches and public parades by the women of the suffragette movement in Britain, Gavron’s film uses the perspective of an ordinary woman to explore what instilled these women with such drive and determination. That woman is the fictional amalgam of working class women of the time named Maud Watts (Carey Mulligan), who was initially an outsider to the cause but who eventually crosses paths with key figures in the real-life suffragettes’ history such as Emmeline Pankhurst (Meryl Streep), Emily Davison (Natalie Press), and Edith Ellyn (Helena Bonham Carter)." -- Frank Wilkins Reel Reviews
results.name: Film: Suffragette (2015)

results.description:
Emotional Rescue: How to Work With Your Emotions - New York City  
Friday, May 6th 7:00 - 9:00 pm - with Ethan Nichtern  
Cost: $25  
Location: Baryshnikov Performing Arts Center: Jerome Robbins Theatre, 450 West 37th Street, New York, NY 10018

"Ponlop Rinpoche gives us here a down-to-earth guide to recognize, understand, transform and utilize the basic energy of even our negative emotions to live fresh and genuinely happy lives.”    — Richard Gere

Emotions bring color and meaning to our lives, but they can also put us on an exhausting rollercoaster ride.

Only by learning to relate to our emotions skillfully can we benefit from their richness and gain wisdom, instead of letting them control us. When we bring awareness to our emotions, something truly amazing happens, they lose their power to make us miserable.

When you begin to open your heart to the suffering of the world, it can sometimes feel overwhelming. How do we work with the intense emotions that arise so we can find ways to act with compassion in our communities?

On May 6, 2016, Nalandabodhi New York and co-presenter The Interdependence Project will host a special program featuring celebrated Buddhist teacher, Dzogchen Ponlop Rinpoche.

This public talk will feature in-person teachings from Ponlop Rinpoche (marked by his usual warmth and humor). In addition, Ethan Nichtern, a senior teacher in the Shambhala Buddhist tradition, will interview Ponlop Rinpoche. 

To join us, register in advance here.

To order by phone, call toll free. Real people are standing by 24/7 to take your ticket purchase: [masked]


Want to dive deeper? Register for the entire weekend workshop.
If you are a student or under age 30, use the promo code RESCUE - will grant admission to Saturday and Sunday programs for only $25.

Biographies

Dzogchen Ponlop Rinpoche is a widely celebrated Buddhist teacher and the author of "Rebel Buddha: A Guide to a Revolution of Mind." A lover of music, art and urban culture, Rinpoche is a poet, photographer, accomplished calligrapher and visual artist, as well as a prolific author. Rinpoche is founder and president of Nalandabodhi, an international network of Buddhist centers.

Ethan Nichtern is a Shastri, a senior teacher in the Shambhala Buddhist tradition. He is the author  of the acclaimed book "The Road Home: A Contemporary Exploration of the Buddhist Path" (Farrar Straus and Giroux, North Point Press), which was recently selected as one of Library Journals Best Books of 2015, and one of Tech Insiders 9 Books That Define 2015.

results.description:
One of the biggest questions I hear from followers and clients: "What Do I Say to Her?"

How do you start a conversation with a stranger? How do you avoid coming across weird or over-eager? What if the situation is awkward or they seem busy?

I'm going to address all these questions and a lot more in this free talk on the art of approaching.

Effective approaching is more an "art" than a "science."

We will explore how to develop your social confidence, the importance of your first impression, and using the power of your common sense to maximize your results and avoid errors.

Justin

Directed by Hal Ashby 

Having lived his life as the gardener on a millionaire's estate, Chance (Peter Sellers) knows of the real world only what he has seen on TV. When his benefactor dies, Chance walks aimlessly into the streets of Washington D.C., where he is taken in by wealthy Eve Rand (Shirley MacLaine). Because Chance is so well mannered, everyone assumes he must be a man of profound intelligence. No matter what he says, it is interpreted as a pearl of wisdom and insight. Both a modern fable and a political satire, Being There is based on the novel by Jerzy Kosinski.

Post-film discussion led by Chris Everett

results.description:
I'll be camping the night before a section hike along the Appalachian Trail in Connecticut.  Join me if you like.

The group size limit for camping at this site is 6. I will be making this a waitlist only event. First dibs will go to those who are already confirmed on my AT Section hike, then for others doing HVH hikes in the Taconics that weekend.

There is a fee of $10 for this campsite payable in cash on arrival.

What to Bring:

It's still a bit cold at night in the mountains. You need a good sleeping bag rated to 20 degrees F or lower. In addition to a sleeping bag, you need a very good sleeping pad. It is important to have insulation between you and the ground. The filling in your sleeping bag that is underneath you will be compressed and provide no insulation. I highly recommend a sleeping pad with an R value of at least 5. (Hint: most closed cell foam pads have a 2.5 R value. If you double them up you will have a combined R value of 5.)

You will also need something to keep the weather off of you while you sleep. Since we're below the tree line, any small 3 season tent should do. You want something with good ventilation so that you don't get soaked in condensation over night.

I also ask that all participants bring a small bundle of wood. You can purchase local wood. There are strict regulations on transporting firewood within the State of New York. If you plan to carry wood from home, it must be kiln dried. If you want to see why this is so important, go check out the birch trees in the Adirondacks.
results.name: Spring Camping in the Taconics

How do you start a conversation with a stranger? How do you avoid coming across weird or over-eager? What if the situation is awkward or they seem busy?

I'm going to address all these questions and a lot more in this free talk on the art of approaching.

Effective approaching is more an "art" than a "science."

We will explore how to develop your social confidence, the importance of your first impression, and using the power of your common sense to maximize your results and avoid errors.

Ripley-Grier Studios

520 8th Ave

Room 10F

See you there!

Justin

http://JustinAttraction.com

http://NaturalAttractionNYC.com
results.how_to_find_us: Room 10F
results.name: "What Do I Say to Her?" The Art of Approaching: Free Talk

results.description:
Hannah Min, violin and Zach Mo, piano present an evening of selected works by Brahms!


This concert is free and open to the public. RSVP is requested: please register via Meetup, by emailing [masked], or by calling (212) 753-8811. 

A meet-the-artist wine reception will follow the performance!

Korean-Canadian violinist Hannah Min is an active freelance performer and chamber musician in New York City. Ms. Min has been reviewed in the New York Times as playing a “vivid, colorful and urgent performance“ with “piercing clarity”. She has been heard in venues such as Carnegie Hall’s Zankel Hall and Issac Stern Auditorium, Merkin Hall, Lincoln Center’s Avery Fisher Hall as well as in performance spaces throughout Europe and Asia. She has had the privilege of working and collaborating with some of the world’s most renowned musicians such as Kurt Masur, Helmuth Rilling, Ani Kavafian, Placido Domingo, Julian Rachlin, Pinchas Zukerman, Joshua Bell, Hilary Hahn and Valery Gergiev. In addition to performing Classical repertoire in many orchestral and small ensemble settings, Hannah has played sold out shows with pop artists such as M83, Zedd, Josh Groban and can also be heard on Broadway. Ms. Min is a graduate of Manhattan School of Music where she received her Master of Music degree. 

Pianist Zach Mo has established himself as one of the pre-eminent performers and teachers of his generation. He has traveled around the globe as a performer and educator, playing throughout Europe, Asia, and the United States. While he is an accomplished and able solo performer, Zach’s passion for collaboration extends his performance milieu to chamber ensembles, choral settings, and orchestral performances. He is the pianist and co-founder of the Caspian Piano Trio, a group whose high level of performance has gained them a reputation in New York City for high-quality, memorable chamber music.
results.name: Hannah Min and Zach Mo Play Brahms

results.description:
This film kicks off the Panorama Europe 2016 series at the museum:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rsnkKW5Oflk

With actress Valeria Golino in person. Followed by reception. 
Presented by the Italian Cultural Institute

New York premiere. Italy/France. Dir. Giuseppe M. Gaudino. 2015, 
117 mins. In Italian with English subtitles.
With Valeria Golino, Massimiliano Gallo, Adriano Giannini. 

A woman’s downward spiral is viscerally evoked in this fantastical and psychologically charged character study. Winner of the Best Actress award at the Venice Film Festival, Valeria Golino is astonishing as a wife and mother losing her grip as she contends with a brutish criminal husband and three rebellious children. An affair with a dashing television actor seems to offer an escape—but is it also a dead end? Shot in evocative black-and-white—with surreal bursts of color to convey the protagonist’s memories and fantasies—Anna is an emotionally shattering portrait of a woman coming undone.

Tickets: $12 (Free for members at the Film Lover and MoMI Kids Premium levels and above). Order tickets online. (Members may contact 
[masked] with any questions regarding online reservations.) 

Not all of these films will be posted as events.  If you wish to see more of them (click link above the trailer), you may wish to consider becoming a Film Lover level member so your tickets will be free.

Note:  We are only posting 5 of the films as events and I will not be able to attend the entire series.  The first two people who arrives at the museum will have their pick of a free ticket to a film in this series that I am not attending.


 UPDATE:  The museum is offering a Festival Pass for this entire series for $40. Click here for full list of films and purchase link for the pass.

UPDATE:  This screening is sold out.  If you have not yet purchased or reserved your ticket(s) and do not wish to come to try for Standby Tickets, please change your RSVP.

Please be sure your communication settings allow you to receive updates regarding this event.

Originally posted 4/22/16. 
First update on 5/1/16
Second update on 5/6/16 at 9:45 AM.

results.description:
This exhibition brings together paintings by five artists — Nina Chanel Abney, Mathew Cerletty, Jamian Juliano-Villani, Caitlin Keogh, and Orion Martin. Highlighting an engagement with representation among some emerging artists, the works in this group conjure a sense of space that is dimensionless and airless, like the illusionistic scenery flats used on stage and movie sets. Each of these artists fills their compositions with objects, bodies and places that are based on reality, yet are exaggerated, recontextualized, simplified or flattened. The individual works are imbued with both the uncertainty of our sociopolitical moment as well as the seductive quality of consumerism and physical attraction. The paintings in Flatlands invite the viewer to reflect on this ever-present polarity and ambivalence of contemporary life.

Pay What You Wish
Fridays, 7–10 pm
results.name: Paintings

venue.name: Rubin Museum of Art - K2 Lounge / Cafe Serai

results.description:
Bodhisattvas (Buddhists and like/opened minded compassionate friends) are now everywhere yet still hard to find.  So come join us and get connected with other bodhisattvas from the New York Metro area.  Every Friday we meet other compassionate friends at the Rubin Museum Cafe in a relaxed and easy going atmosphere.

Bodhi Lounge is a social/entrepreneurial meetup for Buddhists, or anyone interested in meeting Buddhists and learning about Buddhism. That said, people of any faith or practice—or no spiritual practice—are all welcome!  Let's all get along and learn from each other. So let's meet and have a cheerful time making new friends and/or helping each other grow our friendships or businesses!

So why are we always at the Rubin Museum Cafe and not check out other locations?  Rubin Museum is a Himalayan museum, which means mostly Buddhist art.  Thus we like this museum!  Also, by being at one location all the time, people now can just show up if their schedule opens up.  There, that easy!

This is a joint social between Bodhi Lounge and Dharma Drink.  We are always at one location; ask the museum staff for the Dharma Drink group.  If the first staff does not know, ask another. 

See you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the museum staff for the Buddhist social group!
results.name: Weekly Social with Like Minded Friends @ Rubin Museum Cafe

results.description:
Women’s New Moon Sacred Celebration- Honoring the Divine Mother featuring the Dance of Liberation!

We will honor ourselves, our ancestors, and the ultimate mother, Mother Earth, in a joyous and expansive evening featuring special guest Dina Divine & The Dance of Liberation!

"The Dance of Liberation® is a unique form of movement therapy that heals and frees physical, mental, emotional and spiritual blockages. Utilizing dance, contemporary shamanism, hands on healing, drumming and global music, this powerful and beautiful soul work sheds inhibitions and heightens inner awareness in a safe and carefully monitored group setting." -Parashakti.org

We will embrace the power of the moon and cycles of nature, dance and release energy no longer serving us, receive divine messages and inspiration, and enjoy high-vibration organic vegan chocolate and tonics!

Please wear a skirt or dress if you feel called, bring any pictures of inspiring women or photos of your ancestors, and an open heart to be filled with bliss!

Date: Friday May 6th 2016

Time: 7-9:00pm

Where: YogaNesh Yoga Studio
208 West 29th Street
Chelsea, NYC

Cost: $25 or two for $40 if one brings a friend.

RSVP for one: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=2YC8XWYVCQJXQ

RSVP for two: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=UXF88JWC2AFFW

Dina Turetsky (aka Dina Divine) is a multi-cultural artist, photographer, healer, spiritual student and entrepreneur. She is a founder of BeLightLiving, an organization to promote workshops on yoga and other shamanic practices in order to create awareness, balance and harmony. She believes in promoting and spreading the light through dance and hands on healing. Dina is a Dance of Liberation facilitator since early 2012. She has been co-leading classes with the Dance of Liberation teachers in NYC. She taught DOL at Burning Man 2012 and 2015. Dina brings the teachings internationally, she taught DOL in the Mayan forest in Guatemala & is Parashaktis & DOL’s personal professional photographer.

Sarah Eve Cardell is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki healer and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with Izhak Beery and followed with the late Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Other trips including Mexico and Central America, Europe, Israel, and Southeast Asia, she encountered sacred spiritual practices and healers in which she is blessed to share and teach. She completed her 200 & 500-hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. Integrating her experience as a gourmet holistic chef, she uses food as another tool in achieving whole body health. Whether in private healing sessions, workshops and retreats, she facilitates a space in which you can heal you. www.sarahevecardell.com

All text, images, and products presented are copyright. Copyright © 2016 Sarah Eve Cardell. All rights reserved.
results.name: Women’s New Moon Sacred Celebration- featuring the Dance of Liberation!

results.description:
hello friends


I'm performing at Joe's Pub this Friday May 6th.  We'll be doing songs from our latest album that won the Canadian Folk Music Award for Best World Album.  The music is a fuzion of modern Indian & African desert blues and I'm looking forward to entertaining you with my band of awesomes: 

Downbeat Critics Poll's Top Ten Guitarist Rez Abbasi; groovy as ever tabla player Nitin Mitta; superbly melodic accordion player Will Holshouser and the always funky bassist Chris Tarry

Here's a bit of my music......


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zi3ZmT8rlac&feature=youtu.be


Save $5 by getting advance tickets here....


http://joespub.publictheater.org/reserve/index.aspx?performanceNumber=30981&SiteTheme=JoesPub


Here is more info on the music & me - www.KiranMusic.com

xo

Kiran
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the lobby after the concert.
results.name: Indian FUZION concert at Joe's Pub this Fri May 6

group.name: New York City Culture & Social Club

results.description:
When two people love each other they create a "suitable saddle" for a Third Force to ride. Love attracts angels that protect and guide the beloveds. The Third Force, a numinous presence, joins two people and can expand to include family and community. A group soul united in purpose can be a spiritual braid of empowered energy and influence to catalyze planetary transformation. A place to affirm oneness and a connection to the divine, a temple is a declaration to the world of the power of love and unity. Since the earliest architecture, higher vision has been expressed by building sacred space with a community aligned in spirit.

Artists Alex Grey and Allyson Grey, co-founders of CoSM, Chapel of Sacred Mirrors, will share their journey of painting, performance art and social sculpture that has led to building Entheon, a sanctuary of Visionary Art, now in construction in the Hudson Valley. This program will support the Entheon Kickstarter Campaign in progress.

Tickets: https://theinevitableconsequenceoflove.splashthat.com/
$20 in advance
$25 at the door

https://www.facebook.com/events/1175878819112413/

results.name: Singles Happy Hour Meetup (Comp Apps, Drink Specials, Icebreakers) Pre-Pay Only

results.description:
Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise. 10-session program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating. The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed. We offer a more humane and effective alternative. Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out. We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.

Initial session is free of charge. If you do decide to enroll at the
Free Trial, you will receive a $49.00 discount, and 2 bonus sessions.

Discounted rate:$250 for 12 sessions.

Regular rate: $299 for 10 sessions
results.name: Acting Class

World Accordion Day Concert!

World Accordion Day Concert - Accordion was first patented on May 6th, 1829.
Accordionists all over the worlds are celebrating this special day with concerts/galas (see the list here).   Let's celebrate our beloved accordion's birthday!   Bring your friends and families : )  Kids friendly event.


Friday, May 6th, 7pm-9pm @ 61 Local

Admission: $5 per person

B. Y. O. Accordion!

Calling for performers! - Interested in performing 2-3 pieces at the World Accordion Day concert?  There is a limited space for performers for this event.

Please sign up by responding to this email - All level/genre of music welcome!

results.description:
This event is now completely sold out for men. We have space available for women only.

Speed dating is the most effective way for men and women to meet. Nothin' beats meeting someone face to face in a nice and safe environment.

Join us for an unforgettable night of speed dating, where you will meet up to 10 singles just like you in one FUN evening!

How does it work?

You will go on about 10 dates with someone of the opposite sex, each date will be 5 minutes long/short. We will provide you with materials to tell us who you liked. If the same person(s) you pick also pick you, you will be a "Match" and we will give you each others' contact information - then the rest is up to you! Call each other up and make plans to go out!

Recommended ages: Men 25-38, Women 23-36

Tickets are $25 if you RSVP on our Meetup group / $40 at door without RSVP if space is available.


PS: We are promoting this event on several Asian professionals groups, so don't go by the amount people you see RSVP on our Meetup alone - we assure you we will have a good amount of men and women participate at our event.

results.description:
Imagine a group of people, picking up a drum or some percussion; and next thing you know everyone is jamming! The air is filled with infectious sound and movement. You are floating and really feeling the beat! Sound is healing!

Drums and percussion available 
$15 at the door

EarthMovers Drum Collective was formed so that everyone could have fun drumming at a circle and share in the rhythm and excitement of the collective drumming experience. Founder and facilitator Dave Miller started drumming with pots and pans, but his love for the art of drumming really grew in 1986 when he held a backyard garden blessing and friends came with drums and percussion. Dave has studied with Babatundi Olatunji, Greg “Sule” Wilson, Marie Tashian, Greg Hochman, Sheik Fall, Fred Goodnight, Jim Dav, Nadine Bergeron, Mark Wood and others. EarthMovers Drum Collective has performed at Kindred Spirits Fair, Saratoga Springs Jazz Festival, Synthetic Pleasure, Harvest Moon Fest, GoddessFest, on the beach, in parks and more.

Dave has enthusiastically performed and grooved at Starwood, Drums Around the World, New Rochelle Arts Festival, Fall Frolic, Drums from Heaven, The Head Start Program, Trenton Makes Words!, Rutgers University and with the PeaceWeavers, Spook Handy, Earth Vision Weavers, Triangle Drum Circle, Joachim Becker, Greg Metz, Sharon Silverstein, Hands of Change, Music For The Goddess, Mark Wood and others.

Dave has produced a variety of music programs and festivals for over 40 years and was a radio host for 7 years. He currently facilitates monthly drum circles and offers Pied Piper Parties drumming for children and adults, both privately and in schools and corporate settings. Contact: Dave Miller[masked] [masked] 
[masked]

on 480 Midland Ave. in Garfield.

9 Years ago, a formal High school Student was killed while training with the Navy Seals -The tragic news shook the community, especially who knew this fine young man who bravely served his county

to Honor him the Freddie Porter Scholarship was born, and every year we hold a Beefsteak Dinner to raise funds for exceptional young people who dream of going to college but need a helping hand.

group.name: The Adventures of Gilligan's  Meetup Group

results.description:
A remarkable literary debut -- shortlisted for the Man Booker Prize! The unflinching and powerful story of a young girl's journey out of Zimbabwe and to America.

Darling is only ten years old, and yet she must navigate a fragile and violent world. In Zimbabwe, Darling and her friends steal guavas, try to get the baby out of young Chipo's belly, and grasp at memories of Before. Before their homes were destroyed by paramilitary policemen, before the school closed, before the fathers left for dangerous jobs abroad.

But Darling has a chance to escape: she has an aunt in America. She travels to this new land in search of America's famous abundance only to find that her options as an immigrant are perilously few. 

NoViolet Bulawayo's debut calls to mind the great storytellers of displacement and arrival who have come before her-from Junot Diaz to Zadie Smith to J.M. Coetzee-while she tells a vivid, raw story all her own.
results.name: ***POSTPONED**We Need New Names by NoViolet Bulawayo

results.description:
Over and over and over. We are on auto pilot now, so we will have this, or another event, at a place to be determined, (TBD), every two weeks, with a pancake or some other panic event tossed in to keep everyone aggravated to the fullest.

As usual, if you RSVP 'yes' but can't make it, call or text me; your merry group organizer, Greg, at[masked] 1066.(we don't want to worry about you all night)


And the standard 'It's -OK- to decide to come at the last minute, without an RSVP, or late, or bring well behaved young ones' is in effect as well.  no need to call, just show up. the tables aren't nailed down and another can always be added.


Veggie Heaven is open till 11pm, and sometimes later(we loose track of time, someone keeps ordering scallion pancakes, and the staff is slow to tie up the evening's loose ends, so we are usually there for a good spell, I think 1:30AM is our record). Thus, lateness due to scheduling issues, etc, is no biggie. 

If we have a change of venue, for any given week, we will let you know in advance.

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/
results.how_to_find_us: We meet at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center in Bayside, Queens. We convene in the Community Room.

results.description:
Come join this wonderful on going FRIDAY EVENING co-ed (men and women) Yoga Class 7:15-8:15pm.  This is an adult yoga class for all ages and levels (if interested in children's yoga, please contact me).  Beginners are welcome and encouraged to join.  NO gym membership required.  Reiki is part of the entire class, however specifically given to each person during the quiet beginning of the class (meditation and centering) and at the end of the class during Savasana (the final pose). Each person receives Reiki during the entire class.  If you have a mat, you can bring it.  If you do not have a mat, I have some to share.  Please visit

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.


Your first class is $10.  Future classes are sold in groups of 4 classes for $40 (still $10 per class).  NO gym membership required.  If you miss a class, you do NOT lose the class- it just stays in your account for future use :) but expires one year from purchase.  This is a wonderful class that builds upon your connection to your inner voice, connects you to your inner wisdom and divine consciousness.  You will build strength, flexibility and peace of mind... come join our group! :)
results.name: On Going FRIDAY EVENING Yoga with Reiki (both men and women are in this class)

results.description:
The Spiritual Law of Reversed Effort


"The law of reversed effort is simply that the harder a person struggles to achieve some goal, the more difficulty he will have to overcome; difficulty caused, at least in part, by the strain of his effort."
                                      —Harold Klemp, The Spiritual Laws of ECK

Spiritual laws govern our inner and outer universes. Join spiritually like-minded people for a discussion on the Spiritual Law of Reversed Effort.  Our open discussion format offers the opportunity to explore ideas, share your experiences, ask questions, or hear from others. 

This FREE Meetup repeats on the 1st Friday of every month at the same location and time.  Look for our future postings for discussions on other spiritual laws, based on the book, The Spiritual Laws of Life by Harold Klemp, the Spiritual Leader of ECKANKAR. (It is not necessary to have the book to attend.)

We look forward to meeting you for the first time or seeing you again. Feel free to bring a friend.

Friday, May 6th, 7:30 pm


Robbins Room, Administration Building at St. Luke's Church 
17 Oak Avenue, Metuchen, NJ 08840  

For more information on this and other events being held throughout the state, visit our Eckankar in New Jersey site:  www.eckankar-nj.org

You're also welcome to see us on Facebook:  facebook.com/Eckankarnj

For more information on the Eckankar books, 
visit www.eckbooks.org

<a href="http://www.eckankar-nj.org"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: Off Rt. 27, adjacent to St. Luke’s Church; park and enter in rear of building
results.name: The Spiritual Law of Reversed Effort

results.description:
So some good news Dangerfield's Comedy Club the Longest running Comedy club in the world, started by Rodney Dangerfield himself 45 years ago has been generous to extend free tickets to our meetup group. This should be a fun meetup. This is not an Amateur or Gimmick Comedy show, Dangerfields features best of the best comedians who have performed in leading clubs, motion pictures and tv shows such as Tonight Show with Jay leno, Jimmy Fallon, Letterman, Seth meyers, Conan and Comedy Central. HBO's most successful comedy TV specials were taped at this club.

Im very excited to have the meetup here, We are getting tickets that are $40.00 each free for this group, its a 2 drink minimum as in any other club but if you get a drink at the bar before the show it counts toward the drink minimum which is very rare for a comedy club and theres a full food menu. If you want to just stop by have a drink and meet your fellow meetup members and not stay for the show you can do that too youll still get a ticket if you wanna use it for another time.

Hope to see you there. This weeks is hosted by Q (Quinten Heggs), Lineup included Des Bishop (Comedy Central), Andrew Schulz (Guy, Code, Comedy Central), Al D. (TruTV), Drew Fraser (BET) more will be named.

Ive personally never been to this club, but the Organizer will have a meetup sign, we all sit together, and meet each other so look for the meetup sign and the organizer will give you the Free Tickets.

Show Starts at 8:30, so come at 7:45 to meet your fellow meetup members! Enjoy!
results.name: Dangerfields Friday Night Meetup Free Tix!

group.name: Free NYC! Free Things To Do In NYC + beyond! (or very cheap)

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

You don't have to be a genius to participate in this Trivia Night! Come  out and enjoy a night of food drink, conversation and a little friendly competition! Test your skills as New York Social Network Founder Dave Cervini hosts a fun evening that will have you thinking, laughing and learning about pop culture, music, TV, Movie, History, NYC and more.

Most questions are easy and others you may have to rely on your teammates for help. Come alone or with a friend. Even if you think you don’t know much trivia, it is still a great way to meet others in the group. We will have special sections set aside for NYSN members to meet and team up.  Pay as you go for food and drink. There are several rounds and prizes awarded for each round! We will rotate everyone to new teams after each round (unless you have a  team already)

Can I come alone? Yes! If you do not know anyone there we will introduce you to others and make you part of teams.

What should I wear? Most come from work but St Pats is a pub with a very casual atmosphere.

Can I eat there? They have burgers, quesadillas, veggie sandwiches, salads, pizza, burrito's and more. If you want to eat with the group, plan to get there around 7:15pm.

How long does it last? We have 3 rounds of 15 questions each.  The trivia usually lasts until about 9:30pm.  After that some stay and socialize and other head home.

How do I get there? It is near the corner of west 85th and Columbus Avenue.  The B,C stop a block away at CPW and 86th and the #1 stops at B'way and 86th.
results.name: Fun and Easy Rotating Team Trivia Night & Party at St. Pat's Midtown Bar & Grill

If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

You don't have to be a genius to participate in this Trivia Night! Come  out and enjoy a night of food drink, conversation and a little friendly competition! Test your skills as New York Social Network Founder Dave Cervini hosts a fun evening that will have you thinking, laughing and learning about pop culture, music, TV, Movie, History, NYC and more.

Most questions are easy and others you may have to rely on your teammates for help. Come alone or with a friend. Even if you think you don’t know much trivia, it is still a great way to meet others in the group. We will have special sections set aside for NYSN members to meet and team up.  Pay as you go for food and drink. There are several rounds and prizes awarded for each round! We will rotate everyone to new teams after each round (unless you have a  team already)

Can I come alone? Yes! If you do not know anyone there we will introduce you to others and make you part of teams.

What should I wear? Most come from work but St Pats is a pub with a very casual atmosphere.

Can I eat there? They have burgers, quesadillas, veggie sandwiches, salads, pizza, burrito's and more. If you want to eat with the group, plan to get there around 7:15pm.

How long does it last? We have 3 rounds of 15 questions each.  The trivia usually lasts until about 9:30pm.  After that some stay and socialize and other head home.

How do I get there? It is near the corner of west 85th and Columbus Avenue.  The B,C stop a block away at CPW and 86th and the #1 stops at B'way and 86th.

results.description:
We are pleased to present:

Brick by Brick: A Civil Rights Story (2007)  

The film is a one-hour made-for-television documentary about a contemporary American battle for civil rights.  It follows three families in Yonkers, New York, in the middle of a confrontation about the politics and law of racial discrimination in housing and schools that challenges and changes their hometown.

The film describes how a ghetto was created through public policies.  The film initially paints a picture of isolation for many people of color in the city, most of whom are living in segregated neighborhoods served by failing schools.  The primary storytellers are local people from different backgrounds, who relate their personal encounters with housing and educational discrimination, as well as others who experience very different opportunities across town.

Brick by Brick tracks the resulting federal US v Yonkers litigation, which challenged neighborhood and educational discrimination. Coming back out of the courtroom into the community, the story describes the bitter local confrontation about race and the very concept of community that follows.

Following the film there will be a brief presentation by Bart Worden, of the Ethical Culture Society, to bring the story up to the present and explain the lasting impact of the forces depicted in the film.  There will be discussion about our choices as residents and citizens for opening up the County to more rational and equitable housing policies.
results.name: First Friday Films Series:  Documentaries that Mean Something

results.description:
Dear Yogis & Yoginis: 


Greetings! ^_^

As Mother's Day is drawing near. I would like to arrange a class dedicated to our mothers (or anyone in our life that we regard as our mother), who gave us life, raised us up, and nurtured and educated us with tender and care. Therefore, the theme of the coming class will be "Opening the Heart" by focusing on backbends, which open our heart chakra (one of the centers of spiritual power in the human body)--the bridge of love between chakras and between our physical energy centers and spiritual ones. And we'll practice with our moms in mind and heart.

As usual, the class this week is open to yoga lovers, in particular, beginners. It emphasizes the fundamentals of yoga through informative instructions. As intermediate to advanced yogis may find it too simple, it is always good to go back to the basics to refine our alignments of asanas (steady and easeful yoga postures). With that being said, you are all warmly welcomed!

The address of the studio is:

CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)

123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th St, above "Think Coffee")

Tel: <a>[masked]</a>

Please press the button "CRS" and the secretary will buzz you in. After you enter the building, head directly to the 2rd Floor, where the studio is located.

Please kindly bring a yoga mat with you. Yoga mats (not enough supply at times) and props are free of charge. Restrooms are available for use. No locker or changing room so feel free to bring your valuable items with you into the studio room. There is filtered water and cups in the kitchen area. 

Important Notes:  

1) The class will start at 20:45 SHARP so please arrive at least 5 minutes earlier for sign-in and the setting up of your mats and props. Warming up is essential in avoiding injuries in doing yoga so you don't want to miss that. ;)

2) If you decide not to come after you RSVPed "yes", please have the curtesy to change it to "no" to leave spots for others.

3) Please take off your shoes and socks (unless they are nonslip yoga socks) before you enter the room on the 3rd floor.

4) Please put your phone in silent or airplane mode if you decide to take it with you into the studio.

5) Please return all the props and mats properly to the conditions they were in upon leaving. Your cooperation is much appreciated!

From the bottom of my heart, I would like to take this opportunity to wish all mothers and mothers-to-be health and happiness. Being a mom is the greatest and toughest job in the world. May our mothers be surrounded by love.

Love and light.


Namaste, 

Shuai

results.description:
BAMcafe is probably my favorite place in all of NYC to listen to live music. It's one of the most visually attractive spaces in the City, and possesses an atmosphere that just puts you in the mood to be entertained. The artists are always amazing- featuring either up and coming acts or those who've made it and want to play a more intimate venue. Even the crowd that attends usually adds something special by interacting with the artist to create an involved listening experience. And best of all, It's free. Yep, I said it- 100% free. You can't beat that with a stick. Or maybe you can. I don't know- I'm not that familiar with sticks. Anyway, If you want to enjoy good music with good company, all in an amazing space, join us at BAMcafe.

Here's some info about the artist from the BAMcafe website:

This powerhouse R&B quartet blends funk grooves and the bluesy wail of frontman Mark Levy for an irresistibly eccentric sound that draws from the likes of Talking Heads and the Mothers of Invention. Their propulsive live shows tend toward the outrageously theatrical, while lyrically they spin offbeat narratives about everything from witches’ hats to shipwrecks to the mysteries of the Hollywood Hills.


 I recommend you check out their website, here, and check out a couple videos of their performances. 

One last thing to keep in mind, the space isn't tiny, but it has been known to fill up quickly in the past. Getting there on time or even a little early goes a long way toward not standing while you enjoy the show. I'll get there early and try to save as many seats as possible, but some help with that would be appreciated.
results.name: BAMcafe: The Academy Blues Project

results.description:
COME JOIN US IN OUR HAPPY SPACE AND CHOSE TO START THE NEW YEAR WITH EVEN MORE AND MORE LAUGHTER!   COME GIVE IT A TRY!!!  

You are responsible for your own happiness so be sure to use any tools offered to get you there!  With Laughter Yoga we have seen great results!

Laughter Yoga combines Unconditional Laughter with Yogic Breathing (Pranayama). Anyone can Laugh for No Reason, without relying on humor, jokes or comedy. Laughter is simulated as a body exercise in a group; with eye contact and childlike playfulness, it soon turns into real and contagious laughter. The concept of Laughter Yoga is based on a scientific fact that the body cannot differentiate between fake and real laughter. One gets the same physiological and psychological benefits.

LOTS OF FUN AND YOU MEET GREAT PEOPLE AT EACH SESSION THAT BRING IN SUCH GOOD ENERGY........you leave rejuvenated and energetic.  Come give it a try!   :)

results.description:
The renowned Brazilian master, performing solo works and duets with Larry Del Casale

Tickets required: $30 (click here to purchase)

“Barbosa-Lima has technique that is staggering and uses dynamics that few guitarists seem capable of … he is able to create utterly enduring jewels in music.” — All About Jazz


Program:
Solo:
CARRILLO Sabor a mi
DOMINGUEZ Frenesi
MONTANA Porro
PIXINGUINHA Cochichando, Um a Zero
BARROSO Aquarela do Brasil
MADRIGUERA Adios
FUENTES La Bikina
GERSHWIN Promenade, I Got Rhythm
BARRIOS MANGORÉ Las Abejas
LOBO Tristeza
JOBIM One Note Samba


Duets with Larry Del Casale:
PERNAMBUCO Sons de Carrilhoes
JOBIM Eu nao existo sem voce, Chovendo na Roseira, Luiza, A Felicidade
WILLIAMS Saturday Night at the World, Classical Gas
AZEVEDO Delicado
GERSHWIN Prelude No. 3
BROUWER Micropiezas

Carlos Barbosa-Lima was born in 1944 in Sao Paulo, Brazil. He began studying the guitar at seven years of age. Five years later, Mr. Barbosa Lima made his concert debut in his native city and in Rio de Janeiro. He began recording while still in his teens and continued to appear regularly in concert on Brazilian television. His early studies were with Isaias Savio, who is considered, the father of the modern Brazilian guitar movement, and later with the legendary Andres Segovia.

Since his United States debut in 1967, he has enjoyed a global concert career in which the public and music critics are united in acclaiming him one of the world’s leading masters of the guitar.

Mr. Barbosa-Lima is widely recognized for his extraordinary skills as a performer and as an arranger of a wide variety of music from Scarlatti to Debussy, from Gershwin to Jobim and Brubeck and those in between. His inspired performances have catapulted him onto the world stage.

Larry Del Casale has been performing as a soloist and chamber musician since 1983 as demonstrated on his CD, Zenobia. His love for the ensemble format has afforded him the opportunity to work with a variety of distinguished artists over the years. The New York Times and other publications have praised Mr. Del Casale’s artistry and musicianship in the ensemble format. 

In 1997, Mr. Del Casale was introduced to Carlos Barbosa-Lima through their mutual friend, Puerto Rican composer Ernesto Cordero. After six years of assisting and learning the arrangements of Barbosa-Lima, Del Casale and Barbosa-Lima debuted as a duo at Weill Recital Hall at Carnegie Hall in 2003. Since then, Del Casale has assisted Barbosa-Lima in concert as his duo partner. In 2010, they were guest performers on WNYC’s SoundCheck with host John Schaefer, and a few days later they appeared for a third time at Weill Recital Hall at Carnegie Hall.

In 2012, Barbosa-Lima and Del Casale recorded the Micropiezas by Leo Brouwer for a ZOHO record label release. Both guitarists also performed in New York, France, Italy and Germany. In 2013 the all-Brouwer recording Beatlerianas, featuring Barbosa-Lima, the Grammy Award-winning Havana String Quartet, and Del Casale received a Latin Grammy nomination. 

Del Casale is a graduate of The Mannes College of Music where he studied under the eminent Albert Valdes-Blain and later with guitar virtuoso, Michael Newman. He is also a contributing author for Classical Guitar magazine.

https://youtu.be/CAFmxW3Zzj8

results.description:
https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpt1/v/t1.0-9/13076614_1133421566736763_2213485481915041195_n.jpg?oh=a1b2ff42f83c40ace5d15d790b232ed5&oe=57B9FB8F

New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ. 

If you've never been to Friday Night Blues NYC before, it's a great idea to check out our policies on Blues etiquette and on harassment before coming.


**************************************************************

**************

SCHEDULE:

8:15pm-8:29pm - Class Check-in 
8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson (Close Embrace) w/ Melissa​ and John​
8:30pm-9:30pm - Extended Topics (Moves! Patterns! Dancing!) w/ Flouer​ and special guest instructor Philippe Wilson​!
9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance w/ John and Jeanette H.

Stepping Out Studios is located at 37 West 26th St, 9th Floor. To get buzzed in, dial 9 and the green call button on the keypad to the right of the building entrance.

****************************************************************************

EXTENDED TOPICS:


Series This Month: Moves! Patterns! Dancing!
Learn new stuff & put it together in interesting ways. We are going to focus solely on new partnered vocabulary for your blues dancing. We will push you to remember new sequences & drill them until you can do them in your sleep (or at least on the dance floor).


This Week: 

Read more about our classes at: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/learning

****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues NYC is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 50 to 150 dancers on any given evening.

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12 (sorry, cash only). Purchase both at the same time and pay only $20 for the night!

****************************************************************************

Volunteers get in for FREE!
Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

Stay informed: join our mailing list!

Friday Night Blues NYC is on Yelp! If you enjoy our event, please consider leaving us a review.

results.description:
Prepay required HERE 

Male ages: 35-49 
Female ages: 32-45 


Cost: $35.75 - $40.75 

Part 1-

Informal mingle to meet others attending and make some new friends as our host introduces you to others during this group aspect of the event . 

Part 2- Up to 15 connections in one night, each lasting 4-6 minutes long.  After each round, you will circle yes or no on your scorecard as to whether or not you would be interested in corresponding with that person further.

Part 3- Everyone is welcomed to stay and mingle get to know each other more.  Besides meeting potential people for romance potential, many attendees have made some terrific new friends and business potentials. 

At the end of the evening you will turn in your scorecard for us to tally.  The next morning you will receive an email letting you know who you matched with.  The email will provide you with the person's first name and email address and they will get your first name and email address.  We even let you know the one way matches (they picked you, but you didn't pick them), just in case you change your mind.

Prepay required HERE 
<a href="http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6029"></a>

results.description:
Every other week, we meet up in Elmsford for karaoke. Since the music starts at 10:00, some of us also meet up at 8:30 for dinner beforehand, while others come only for the dinner and drinks. Come join us for some alcohol, bar food, and good times!

There is free valet parking, and when the valet guy leaves, he parks your car very close by (as parking becomes more available) and gives you back your keys. Street parking is also readily available.

If you're interested in both eating and singing, don't forget to sign up for the karaoke event too!
results.name: Bi-weekly Pre-Karaoke Dinner

results.description:
Come Join Us For A Latin/Top 40 Night At Soho Night Club In Fort Lee NJ!


Doors Open At 8:30pm. FREE Dance Lesson At 9pm.

This venue has 3 floors with a bar/restaurant area on the first floor called "The Beer Spot". The club dance area is on the 2nd and 3rd floor. There is also a nice outdoor patio area.

We'll Be On The 3rd Floor Latin Room. LOOK FOR RED BALLOONS & MEETUP SIGNS. Full Bar Available For Drink Ordering.

FREE ENTRY For Meetup Members And There Guest. Good Til 10:30pm. USE CODE WORD "MEETUP" AT THE DOOR FOR THIS SPECIAL.

FREE PARKING IN THERE HUGE LOT. ENTER THERE DRIVEWAY AND PARK BEHIND THE BUILDING. THEN ENTER THROUGH BACK ENTRANCE. LOOK FOR SOHO SIGN.


DJ Mix of Latin, Some Top 40, & Classics As Well.

Multiple Meetup Groups Will Be In Attendance.

Do note the music does tend to get loud. Highly recommended to arrive by 8:30pm to 9:45pm to socialize and mingle before the music kicks in and it's to hard to hear.

3rd Floor DJ will play mostly latin music. You may also check out the 2nd floor which has more of a club top 40 & hip hop dj mix.
results.how_to_find_us: AFTER ENTRANCE, GO UPSTAIRS TO 3RD FLOOR- LOOK 4 RED BALLOONS

results.description:
You just got a bill from your Dr that isn't covered by insurance, Con-Ed somehow didn't get your payment last month, Bank of America is tacking on transaction fees when no transactions were made. Don't just sit there and take it.. There are 6 words that get results! 

LET ME SPEAK TO YOUR MANAGER!!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room.

Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Seating is limited..  To Reserve a seat, RSVP through Eventbrite w. your best email and show your confirmation at the door. 

Eventbrite Link: http://bit.ly/1QD3WgJ

Meetup starts at 9 in the front bar

Seating in the backroom starts at 930 and the show starts shortly after. 

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. 

Come out and celebrate the weekend with some laughs!

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
